commit_message:
doc8: Fix spec formatting

Spec files are RST and so they should abide by its formatting rules.
This patch fixes all the issues detected by doc8 in the specs
directory:

    specs/containers-service.rst:178: D002 Trailing whitespace
    specs/container-networking-model.rst:220: D000 Unexpected indentation.
    specs/container-networking-model.rst:313: D001 Line too long
    specs/container-networking-model.rst:315: D001 Line too long
    specs/container-networking-model.rst:317: D001 Line too long
    specs/container-networking-model.rst:327: D001 Line too long
    specs/container-networking-model.rst:329: D001 Line too long
    specs/container-networking-model.rst:331: D001 Line too long
    specs/magnum-horizon-plugin.rst:15: D001 Line too long
    specs/magnum-horizon-plugin.rst:42: D001 Line too long
    specs/magnum-horizon-plugin.rst:53: D001 Line too long
    specs/magnum-horizon-plugin.rst:54: D001 Line too long

Change-Id: I8f8d2fe04f4c52701e8b069d43d24b81949edfa6

subject: doc8: fix incorrect rst block intro
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-25 15:19:38.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/dev/dev-quickstart.rst'], 'message': 'doc8: fix incorrect rst block intro

doc8 spotted
doc/source/dev/dev-quickstart.rst:229: D000 Literal block
expected; none found.

It was due to the previous line having `::` which indicates an
upcoming literal block, when in reality what the previous line was
doing is introducing several textual + literal blocks. A single
colon should suffice for that.

After this patch, the doc directory is doc8 compliant and we should
add a job that checks it for new patches.

Change-Id: I02f128c06af5e13df17392e3a11a5ce84672f0c7
'}]
commit_message:
doc8: fix incorrect rst block intro

doc8 spotted
doc/source/dev/dev-quickstart.rst:229: D000 Literal block
expected; none found.

It was due to the previous line having `::` which indicates an
upcoming literal block, when in reality what the previous line was
doing is introducing several textual + literal blocks. A single
colon should suffice for that.

After this patch, the doc directory is doc8 compliant and we should
add a job that checks it for new patches.

Change-Id: I02f128c06af5e13df17392e3a11a5ce84672f0c7

commit_message:
Use function get_routable_networks_for_network_role() for

fetch all networks, accessible from interface, mapped by
network role. This lookup doesn't honor default gateway,
only specifyed routes valued.

Change-Id: I90d70fd32dcc3cb2a3372febf1e6dade53f85615
Closes-Bug: #1498554

commit_message:
Replaces 'archive policy' by 'archive-policy'

For consistency aspect the first word of the command must be
the resource to view/change, this is not really true for achive policy
and archive policy rule.

This change adds a '-' instead of space to fix that.

Also this change cleanup the command list for more readability.

Change-Id: Ic0218d1977584b33b73c12beaca04352f472971e

subject: Remove quotes from subshell call in bash script
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-23 12:07:31.000000000', 'files': ['contrib/windows/image-builder/runme.sh'], 'message': 'Remove quotes from subshell call in bash script

Always no quotes for $() statement.

We don't need quotes to hold blanks in result:
 # i=$(echo 1 2 3)
 # echo $i
 1 2 3
 #

These quotes can make something wrong in some case:
 # i=$(echo '!')
 #
 # i="$(echo '!')"
 -bash: !: event not found
 #

No real problem for current code, only to use a better code style.

Change-Id: Icb987c4ac37608cf6e25fafd07c810842e297312
Signed-off-by: Zhao Lei <zhaolei@cn.fujitsu.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Remove quotes from subshell call in bash script

Always no quotes for $() statement.

We don't need quotes to hold blanks in result:
 # i=$(echo 1 2 3)
 # echo $i
 1 2 3
 #

These quotes can make something wrong in some case:
 # i=$(echo '!')
 #
 # i="$(echo '!')"
 -bash: !: event not found
 #

No real problem for current code, only to use a better code style.

Change-Id: Icb987c4ac37608cf6e25fafd07c810842e297312
Signed-off-by: Zhao Lei <zhaolei@cn.fujitsu.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-09-22 15:04:03.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/lib/facter/libvirt_package_version.rb'], 'message': 'Handle libvirt version correctly when missing

Since 7.0 did not include a centos version of the libvirt package, the
libvirt_package_version fact caused puppet to spit errors. This change
updates the logic under RedHat based operating systems to ensure that
the output from the yum command is properly parsed.

Change-Id: I87adb8e0262cf9be83ac6766bf974266378e1b30
Closes-Bug: 1485990
Co-Authored-By: Stanislav Makar <smakar@mirantis.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Handle libvirt version correctly when missing

Since 7.0 did not include a centos version of the libvirt package, the
libvirt_package_version fact caused puppet to spit errors. This change
updates the logic under RedHat based operating systems to ensure that
the output from the yum command is properly parsed.

Change-Id: I87adb8e0262cf9be83ac6766bf974266378e1b30
Closes-Bug: 1485990
Co-Authored-By: Stanislav Makar <smakar@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Moving postgresql module to librarian

This adds the postgresql module to our librarian configuration and
removes the code from this repository.

Partial blueprint: fuel-puppet-librarian

commit_message:
Move sysctl module to librarian

This commit removes the sysctl module from the fuel-library code and
replaces it to be managed via librarian. This change also includes an
update to version v0.0.11 as the previous version that was included did
not match an actual release. The upgrade also closes the incorrect noop
tests failures on OSX for Bug 1492438.

Partial blueprint: fuel-puppet-librarian

Change-Id: Ieeb39be2b05da7c7efeaf5a4909e32fc579d2cdf
Closes-Bug: 1492438

commit_message:
Add semantics validation of direct workflow 'join' tasks

* E.g. if we have a task marked with 'join: 10' but it has only
  2 inbound tasks then task specification will raise an exception.
* Minor refactoring and style changes

Change-Id: I311aadd0afa2e05213da1fdd999233dee03afda3
Closes-Bug: #1404205

subject: Remove quotes from subshell call in bash script
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-23 12:04:18.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/repo_server/files/openstack-wheel-builder.sh', 'scripts/scripts-library.sh'], 'message': 'Remove quotes from subshell call in bash script

Always no quotes for $() statement.

We don't need quotes to hold blanks in result:
 # i=$(echo 1 2 3)
 # echo $i
 1 2 3
 #

These quotes can make something wrong in some case:
 # i=$(echo '!')
 #
 # i="$(echo '!')"
 -bash: !: event not found
 #

No real problem for current code, only to use a better code style.

Change-Id: If3a914650749d72c2eb13b9f1307ef7b4319bd2f
Signed-off-by: Zhao Lei <zhaolei@cn.fujitsu.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Remove quotes from subshell call in bash script

Always no quotes for $() statement.

We don't need quotes to hold blanks in result:
 # i=$(echo 1 2 3)
 # echo $i
 1 2 3
 #

These quotes can make something wrong in some case:
 # i=$(echo '!')
 #
 # i="$(echo '!')"
 -bash: !: event not found
 #

No real problem for current code, only to use a better code style.

Change-Id: If3a914650749d72c2eb13b9f1307ef7b4319bd2f
Signed-off-by: Zhao Lei <zhaolei@cn.fujitsu.com>

commit_message:
Implementation of 'rally task abort' command

When run with the --soft key, the 'rally task abort' command should
wait until the currently running benchmark is finished, otherwise
the command interrupts benchmarking immediately after running
scenario iterations are finished.

Add Task get_status(uuid) method to db sqlalchemy api.

NOTE: db schema is updated with new Task statuses. You should execute
`rally-manage db recreate` to fix existing databases.

Co-Authored-By: Mikhail Dubov <mdubov@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Andrey Kurilin <andr.kurilin@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Roman Vasilets <rvasilets@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: Ia07d165037eb98a9542ffdc91b7279ef3c3d496f

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-09-21 16:22:31.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/v1/overcloud_image.py'], 'message': 'Add support for building ironic-python-agent ramdisk

Most upstream development in Ironic is happening on the
agent drivers rather than the pxe drivers. As such, we
need to start moving towards using the agent based drivers.

This patch is the first step in that direction. It allows
building the DIB based agent ramdisk from the openstack
image build command. It currently will not build in any
of the defaults, but this will allow us to set up CI that
is building and using the agent ramdisk in place of the pxe
one.

Change-Id: Idc4486ad55fecf6de16b2855d2d80cbb97f1ab2a
'}]
commit_message:
Add support for building ironic-python-agent ramdisk

Most upstream development in Ironic is happening on the
agent drivers rather than the pxe drivers. As such, we
need to start moving towards using the agent based drivers.

This patch is the first step in that direction. It allows
building the DIB based agent ramdisk from the openstack
image build command. It currently will not build in any
of the defaults, but this will allow us to set up CI that
is building and using the agent ramdisk in place of the pxe
one.

Change-Id: Idc4486ad55fecf6de16b2855d2d80cbb97f1ab2a

commit_message:
Add context to plugin tests

Most of our unit tests for the various plugins run with an empty
context. This adds a minimal context, containing only a task ID, in
order to support a future change to the way random names are
generated. It also makes it easier to add bits to the universal test
context in the future.

Change-Id: I8455c03140896400ec2017a7aa3f0c726508ceae

subject: Fix default ironic api port number
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-23 05:11:32.000000000', 'files': ['ironic_python_agent/cmd/agent.py'], 'message': "Fix default ironic api port number

This patch corrects the default ironic api port number to 6385 from
6835. The default value of 'ipa-api-url' is not used in production
environment since conductor and bare metal node have its own IP
address, but could be used in development environment.
Therefor this patch fixes this trivial error.

- default=APARAMS.get('ipa-api-url', 'http://127.0.0.1:6835'),
+ default=APARAMS.get('ipa-api-url', 'http://127.0.0.1:6385'),

Change-Id: Idb85e95b354a68111f94e8cddd5c1b6227e676ef
"}]
commit_message:
Fix default ironic api port number

This patch corrects the default ironic api port number to 6385 from
6835. The default value of 'ipa-api-url' is not used in production
environment since conductor and bare metal node have its own IP
address, but could be used in development environment.
Therefor this patch fixes this trivial error.

- default=APARAMS.get('ipa-api-url', 'http://127.0.0.1:6835'),
+ default=APARAMS.get('ipa-api-url', 'http://127.0.0.1:6385'),

Change-Id: Idb85e95b354a68111f94e8cddd5c1b6227e676ef

commit_message:
Fix 'cover' tox job

Our 'cover' tox job does not work with release of 'coverage' package v4.0
It fails on option 'ignore-errors' in config section '[report]'.

So, replace usage of this option with CLI option '--ignore-errors'.

Change-Id: I404e3cb63453b0245ac05b4d3cb5780e5b8b7f9a
Closes-Bug: #1497897

revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2015-05-27 18:36:46.000000000', 'files': ['specs/backlog/domain-roles.rst'], 'message': 'Add support for domain specific roles.

Allow the creation of domain roles, allowing a domain role to be used as
part of an assignment, in the same was as you can assign an individual,
global role.

A domain role is a list of one or more roles and/or other domain roles,
and is name-spaced to a domain.

Implements: bp role-groups

Change-Id: I47bce8b23c02bcd6e739ff5d4b131440e30ca079
'}]
commit_message:
Add support for domain specific roles.

Allow the creation of domain roles, allowing a domain role to be used as
part of an assignment, in the same was as you can assign an individual,
global role.

A domain role is a list of one or more roles and/or other domain roles,
and is name-spaced to a domain.

Implements: bp role-groups

Change-Id: I47bce8b23c02bcd6e739ff5d4b131440e30ca079

The client currently downloads the image metadata to check if it's deleted
or not. This logic belongs to the server and it's already implemented
there. Instead of getting the image, send the delete request and catch
the 404 error, which is already raised by the server.

Change-Id: I1e6ef42340f8e380ff99b9d6ca7ea416e0eebfbc
Closes-bug: #1496305
(cherry picked from commit b8a881f5ea89514d715e61b632bc3081a0dde2c6)
(cherry picked from commit e82d9df74cbac9accc8a6724c0759760e44bb315)
"}]
commit_message:
Don't get the image before deleting it

The client currently downloads the image metadata to check if it's deleted
or not. This logic belongs to the server and it's already implemented
there. Instead of getting the image, send the delete request and catch
the 404 error, which is already raised by the server.

Change-Id: I1e6ef42340f8e380ff99b9d6ca7ea416e0eebfbc
Closes-bug: #1496305
(cherry picked from commit b8a881f5ea89514d715e61b632bc3081a0dde2c6)
(cherry picked from commit e82d9df74cbac9accc8a6724c0759760e44bb315)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-22 22:21:50.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/agent/linux/test_dhcp.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/dhcp.py'], 'message': "Remove early yields in _iter_hosts in dhcp agent

There were early yields in the DHCP agent to handling skipping
lease setup for certain IPv6 addresses. However, the setup for
name resolution in _output_addn_hosts_file depends on the same
function so certain IPv6 addresses weren't getting name resolution.

This patch adjusts the function to return a flag indicating that
DHCP isn't required for the port so the callers setting up reservations
can skip based on that and the name resolution setup can continue
as normal.

Change-Id: I81b4669eadaa9119e08c6a5e1d2a7b5959babdcc
Closes-Bug: #1498665
"}]
commit_message:
Remove early yields in _iter_hosts in dhcp agent

There were early yields in the DHCP agent to handling skipping
lease setup for certain IPv6 addresses. However, the setup for
name resolution in _output_addn_hosts_file depends on the same
function so certain IPv6 addresses weren't getting name resolution.

This patch adjusts the function to return a flag indicating that
DHCP isn't required for the port so the callers setting up reservations
can skip based on that and the name resolution setup can continue
as normal.

Change-Id: I81b4669eadaa9119e08c6a5e1d2a7b5959babdcc
Closes-Bug: #1498665

commit_message:
Remove oslo-incubator documentation that's no longer valid

We have already moved to getting the oslo libraries from pip instead of
the old approach which involved copying them to the barbican/openstack
directory. So the documentation regarding the old approach is no longer
needed.

Include ntp on all images

A properly set clock is usually required for a functioning HA
environment, so it makes sense to include ntp on all images by default.

subject: Convert eDeploy data so that rules can process it
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-09-22 13:32:19.000000000', 'files': ['ironic_inspector/plugins/extra_hardware.py', 'ironic_inspector/test/test_plugins_extra_hardware.py'], 'message': "Convert eDeploy data so that rules can process it

eDeploy's return format is a list of lists, in order to use it with
introspection rules we must convert it to dictionary format. This patch
detects if the data is in eDeploy's format and will convert it storing
the new data in introspection_data['extra']. introspection_data['data']
is assumed unusable by introspection rules and will always be removed
from introspection_data after the data is stored in swift.

Change-Id: I25c7ef1f3d3122b80ea98e4d0e64ea20e2eec618
Closes-Bug: #1495649
"}]
commit_message:
Convert eDeploy data so that rules can process it

eDeploy's return format is a list of lists, in order to use it with
introspection rules we must convert it to dictionary format. This patch
detects if the data is in eDeploy's format and will convert it storing
the new data in introspection_data['extra']. introspection_data['data']
is assumed unusable by introspection rules and will always be removed
from introspection_data after the data is stored in swift.

Change-Id: I25c7ef1f3d3122b80ea98e4d0e64ea20e2eec618
Closes-Bug: #1495649

subject: Set a default endpoint value of None
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-22 18:08:15.000000000', 'files': ['ironicclient/common/http.py'], 'message': "Set a default endpoint value of None

When using keystone session data, the endpoint information
may be encoded in the keystone session data, which means the
direct definition of an endpoint shouldn't necessarilly be
required to occur, and just results in data that will be
ignored if found in the session data anyway.

Added a default value of None for endpoint values when the
_construct_http_client method is called.

Change-Id: Ib53f604840ec48a987b8192091e8f8159c358893
Closes-Bug: #1498608
"}]
commit_message:
Set a default endpoint value of None

When using keystone session data, the endpoint information
may be encoded in the keystone session data, which means the
direct definition of an endpoint shouldn't necessarilly be
required to occur, and just results in data that will be
ignored if found in the session data anyway.

Added a default value of None for endpoint values when the
_construct_http_client method is called.

Change-Id: Ib53f604840ec48a987b8192091e8f8159c358893
Closes-Bug: #1498608

The client currently downloads the image metadata to check if it's deleted
or not. This logic belongs to the server and it's already implemented
there. Instead of getting the image, send the delete request and catch
the 404 error, which is already raised by the server.

Change-Id: I1e6ef42340f8e380ff99b9d6ca7ea416e0eebfbc
Closes-bug: #1496305
(cherry picked from commit b8a881f5ea89514d715e61b632bc3081a0dde2c6)
"}]
commit_message:
Don't get the image before deleting it

The client currently downloads the image metadata to check if it's deleted
or not. This logic belongs to the server and it's already implemented
there. Instead of getting the image, send the delete request and catch
the 404 error, which is already raised by the server.

Change-Id: I1e6ef42340f8e380ff99b9d6ca7ea416e0eebfbc
Closes-bug: #1496305
(cherry picked from commit b8a881f5ea89514d715e61b632bc3081a0dde2c6)

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-09-16 06:51:30.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': "Raise exception.Migration earlier in REST API layer

If user requires live-migration with block migrate and mapped volumes, Nova-api
won't get an exception in nova-api. This exception will be raised in nova-compute
node, so user needs to check log on compute node to tell why
he/she trigger a live-migration but the instance is still in running state.
Livirt driver will raise exception like this:

Migration error: Cannot block migrate instance  with mapped volumes

We can make this happen earlier when doing can-live-migration-source,
by doing this, user will get the exception in nova-api this will bring good
user experience, and besides if we raise this exception early , then nova
won't do pre-live-migration and _rollback_live_migration.

Before this patch gets applied, no state changes on instance, and no errors
will return to user, the exception message can only be found in log of
nova-compute.

After this patch gets applied, user will get MigrationPreCheckError in REST
api if requires live-migration with block migrate and mapped volumes.

Closes-Bug: #1484830
Related-Bug: #1457291
Change-Id: I671c57ca61ff3a62a2ad8935d809ff47542b526c
"}]
commit_message:
Raise exception.Migration earlier in REST API layer

If user requires live-migration with block migrate and mapped volumes, Nova-api
won't get an exception in nova-api. This exception will be raised in nova-compute
node, so user needs to check log on compute node to tell why
he/she trigger a live-migration but the instance is still in running state.
Livirt driver will raise exception like this:

Migration error: Cannot block migrate instance  with mapped volumes

We can make this happen earlier when doing can-live-migration-source,
by doing this, user will get the exception in nova-api this will bring good
user experience, and besides if we raise this exception early , then nova
won't do pre-live-migration and _rollback_live_migration.

Before this patch gets applied, no state changes on instance, and no errors
will return to user, the exception message can only be found in log of
nova-compute.

After this patch gets applied, user will get MigrationPreCheckError in REST
api if requires live-migration with block migrate and mapped volumes.

Closes-Bug: #1484830

Added support to deploy product on remote machine via ssh

It is useful in case if there is 2 machines:
the main that has limited resources and used only for development and
the second, that has enough resources to use it for deployment.

subject: Switch back to default net_ticktime parameter
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-20 01:06:04.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/modular/rabbitmq/rabbitmq.pp', 'files/fuel-ha-utils/ocf/rabbitmq'], 'message': 'Switch back to default net_ticktime parameter

In change id (I3aa47b51ae080bb4a8b298c61a629ac8225d2abd) the net tick
time got bumped down from default of 60 to 10 to deal with short time
CPU spikes. These spikes ended up in the rabbitmqctl would become
unresponsive and affected rabbit node was then erased and restarted
by OCF monitor logic of the related pacemaker RA.

Now that we a tracker for number times the rabbitmqctl fails added in
I9dec06fc08dbeefbc67249b9e9633c8aab5e09ca, we should be able bump that
up to deal with short term cpu spikes and leave net_ticktime to deal
with actual network problems.

Change-Id: I71a7b45392daf7483877869ab3c7d80e28351bb5
'}]
commit_message:
Switch back to default net_ticktime parameter

In change id (I3aa47b51ae080bb4a8b298c61a629ac8225d2abd) the net tick
time got bumped down from default of 60 to 10 to deal with short time
CPU spikes. These spikes ended up in the rabbitmqctl would become
unresponsive and affected rabbit node was then erased and restarted
by OCF monitor logic of the related pacemaker RA.

Now that we a tracker for number times the rabbitmqctl fails added in
I9dec06fc08dbeefbc67249b9e9633c8aab5e09ca, we should be able bump that
up to deal with short term cpu spikes and leave net_ticktime to deal
with actual network problems.

Change-Id: I71a7b45392daf7483877869ab3c7d80e28351bb5

subject: Add redis ordering with ceilometer-central
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-02 16:13:04.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/manifests/overcloud_controller_pacemaker.pp'], 'message': "Add redis ordering with ceilometer-central

This is another missing constraint. The `require-all=false` part is good
to have, otherwise Ceilometer (and transitively Heat) would switch to
A/P mode. However, at the moment `require-all=false` isn't a recognized
parameter on Fedora, hence the logic fork based on $::operatingsystem.

Change-Id: I2657087192a05b2d8f0ab04ec60631d35331bf6c
"}]
commit_message:
Add redis ordering with ceilometer-central

This is another missing constraint. The `require-all=false` part is good
to have, otherwise Ceilometer (and transitively Heat) would switch to
A/P mode. However, at the moment `require-all=false` isn't a recognized
parameter on Fedora, hence the logic fork based on $::operatingsystem.

Change-Id: I2657087192a05b2d8f0ab04ec60631d35331bf6c

happen.

subject: Specify api_version for functional tests
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-09-21 09:07:33.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/tests/functional/test_readonly_nova.py', 'novaclient/tests/functional/base.py', 'novaclient/tests/functional/test_quotas.py', 'novaclient/tests/functional/test_keypairs.py', 'novaclient/tests/functional/test_instances.py', 'novaclient/tests/functional/test_volumes_api.py', 'novaclient/tests/functional/test_fixedips.py', 'novaclient/tests/functional/test_servers.py'], 'message': 'Specify api_version for functional tests

Most of functional tests are written for V2.0/V2.1 API version, but
launched on "latest" compute api version('--os-compute-api-version'
flag is not ovveriden + default value of it is "latest").

This patch adds "COMPUTE_API_VERSION" parameter for base TestCase,
which sets --os-compute-api-version flag while running "nova" shell.

Change-Id: I5d711438addaba5282a15fd2b9dde1800f7d7b91
'}]
commit_message:
Specify api_version for functional tests

Most of functional tests are written for V2.0/V2.1 API version, but
launched on "latest" compute api version('--os-compute-api-version'
flag is not ovveriden + default value of it is "latest").

This patch adds "COMPUTE_API_VERSION" parameter for base TestCase,
which sets --os-compute-api-version flag while running "nova" shell.

Change-Id: I5d711438addaba5282a15fd2b9dde1800f7d7b91

subject: Resolve issue with operating heat stack outputs
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6786, 'name': 'Sergey Lukjanov', 'email': 'me@slukjanov.name', 'username': 'slukjanov'}, {'_account_id': 7213, 'name': 'Sahara Hadoop Cluster CI', 'email': 'elastic-hadoop-ci@mirantis.com', 'username': 'savanna-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 7710, 'name': 'Sergey Reshetnyak', 'email': 'sreshetniak@mirantis.com', 'username': 'sreshetniak'}, {'_account_id': 9323, 'name': 'lvdongbing', 'email': 'dongbing.lv@kylin-cloud.com', 'username': 'lvdongbing'}, {'_account_id': 10670, 'name': 'Michael McCune', 'email': 'elmiko@redhat.com', 'username': 'mimccune'}, {'_account_id': 12038, 'name': 'Vitaly Gridnev', 'email': 'gridnevvvit@gmail.com', 'username': 'vgridnev'}, {'_account_id': 12039, 'name': 'Andrey Pavlov', 'email': 'apavlov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'apavlov'}, {'_account_id': 13919, 'name': 'Evgeny Sikachev', 'email': 'esikachov@gmail.com', 'username': 'esikachev'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2015-09-22 22:42:12.000000000', 'files': ['sahara/utils/openstack/heat.py', 'sahara/service/heat/templates.py', 'sahara/service/heat/heat_engine.py', 'sahara/tests/unit/utils/test_heat.py'], 'message': "Resolve issue with operating heat stack outputs

Sometimes, status of heat stack is not changed in DB
right after executing updating of heat stack. Because of
that sahara thinks that heat stack was successfully updated,
but it's wrong, because heat stack updating still in progress.

Because of that it's proposed to use field updated_time
for verification of successful update of heat stack.
We will store that field in variable, and will wait until that
will be changed.

Closes-bug: 1472536
Change-Id: Ifeee9a81ff1b37ff061de0ded371ae6f6bda4c95
"}]
commit_message:
Resolve issue with operating heat stack outputs

Sometimes, status of heat stack is not changed in DB
right after executing updating of heat stack. Because of
that sahara thinks that heat stack was successfully updated,
but it's wrong, because heat stack updating still in progress.

Because of that it's proposed to use field updated_time
for verification of successful update of heat stack.
We will store that field in variable, and will wait until that
will be changed.

Closes-bug: 1472536
Change-Id: Ifeee9a81ff1b37ff061de0ded371ae6f6bda4c95

commit_message:
Pep8 didn't check api/openstack/common.py

flake8 rule in tox.ini has following
exclude rule is exclude = .venv,.git,.tox,dist,doc,*openstack/common*
which excludes api/openstack/common.py

commit_message:
Glance `image set` Resolve Fracturing

Currently `image set` uses the new api, where other parts of osc the old
api is used. This deprecates the v2 api in favour of the v1 to maintain
the same commands across osc. However the functionality now remains
there as people could now be using this functionality.

This also adds the --unprotected argument, as in the previous version if
--protected was not supplied it would just make the argument
--unprotected without the users explicit consent.

The patch also fixes the documentation for image set as it was outdated.

Change-Id: I990d20332c80165102badef7ac94ddbeb7824950
Closes-Bug: 1498092

commit_message:
scenario001: set API workers number to 4

When installing OpenStack-All-in-One with Puppet in OpenStack Infra
Gate, we noticed [1] the same issues than devstack-gate [2] previously
had.
Let's use the same workers number as devstack is currently using so we
avoid more memory issues.
Also, using tox with 4 workers instead of 8.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/74/224974/11/check/gate-puppet-openstack-integration-dsvm-trusty/8217abb/logs/dstat.txt.gz
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2014-September/045396.html

Change-Id: I2ca3d897212cdcf25d8f50c0aef5f377395d4bc6

commit_message:
Disable tempest

We no longer need the RDO kilo repository due to the new delorean-deps
repo.  However, this means we no longer have any tempest package
available as we were pulling it from kilo before (which was probably
also wrong too).

Disable tempest by default. If/when a package becomes available, we can
propose to re-enable it by default.

Change-Id: I18d9cd8213bc2dc1d210250e7d25ddfad318fdce

commit_message:
Allow tempest to deploy when no heat in environment

Currently, the deployment of tempest will fail if heat does not exist
in the environment.  This commit updates
os_tempest/tasks/tempest_resources.yml so that users are only added
to heat_stack_owner role if tempest_service_available_heat is set to
True.

Change-Id: Ib3f6a11de60be86c1b2581d3c8da615d66ebae5b

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-09-21 08:08:33.000000000', 'files': ['manila/tests/share/drivers/test_glusterfs.py', 'manila/share/drivers/glusterfs/__init__.py'], 'message': 'glusterfs: fix gluster-nfs export for volume mapped layout

The nfs.export-dir option is not suitable for specifying
whole volume exports (ie. exports for root directory).

Instead, we have to have nfs.export-volumes = on (contrary
to all other scenarios), and control the export via
the nfs.rpc-auth-{allow,reject} options.

So we subclassed GlusterNFSHelper to GlusterNFSVolHelper,
a new helper class that operates with a similar logic to
its parent, just works with nfs.rpc-auth-{allow,reject}
instead of nfs.export-dir.

The driver code detects if {allow,deny}-acces is performed
with a whole volume backend and if the helper given in
configuration is GlusterNFSHelper, then for the handling of
this call it switches over to GlusterNFSVolHelper.

NOTE: What we *don't* do: we don't set nfs.export-volumes to "on",
it's expected to be done by the admin, beforehand. The reason
is that nfs.export-volumes is not a per-volume option, but a
per-cluster and we don't want to mess up the access control of
the cluster by chance in an over-permissive way. The per-cluster
scope of nfs.export-volumes also implies that using a GlusterFS
backed with gluster-nfs export mechasim and volume mapped layout
is an exclusive choice: the cluster can't host it along with other
export / layout schemes.

Change-Id: Ie4e4d03608f7a380cae790d429f88a5482d88ac8
Closes-Bug: #1495910
'}]
commit_message:
glusterfs: fix gluster-nfs export for volume mapped layout

The nfs.export-dir option is not suitable for specifying
whole volume exports (ie. exports for root directory).

Instead, we have to have nfs.export-volumes = on (contrary
to all other scenarios), and control the export via
the nfs.rpc-auth-{allow,reject} options.

So we subclassed GlusterNFSHelper to GlusterNFSVolHelper,
a new helper class that operates with a similar logic to
its parent, just works with nfs.rpc-auth-{allow,reject}
instead of nfs.export-dir.

The driver code detects if {allow,deny}-acces is performed
with a whole volume backend and if the helper given in
configuration is GlusterNFSHelper, then for the handling of
this call it switches over to GlusterNFSVolHelper.

NOTE: What we *don't* do: we don't set nfs.export-volumes to "on",
it's expected to be done by the admin, beforehand. The reason
is that nfs.export-volumes is not a per-volume option, but a
per-cluster and we don't want to mess up the access control of
the cluster by chance in an over-permissive way. The per-cluster
scope of nfs.export-volumes also implies that using a GlusterFS
backed with gluster-nfs export mechasim and volume mapped layout
is an exclusive choice: the cluster can't host it along with other
export / layout schemes.

Change-Id: Ie4e4d03608f7a380cae790d429f88a5482d88ac8
Closes-Bug: #1495910

commit_message:
MOS6.1 VBox use Intel instead of AMD; starting VMs without GUI

VBox scripts now use Intel e1000 Desktop as
a virtual network adapter instead of
AMD PCNet 32 Fast III used previously.
MOS6.1 -- Intel. MOS 5.x-6.0 --AMD.

Also, add info on starting VMs without GUI
with the headless=1 option in config.sh

Change-Id: I5e446f55fb84e08aede6f360df3558c48bb283ee
Closes-Bug:#1439561
Closes-Bug:#1390635
(cherry picked from commit 1d5fa543909ec7188b85599aa107fa46c2c9a15e)

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-09-21 21:22:08.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/network/test_linux_net.py', 'nova/network/linux_net.py'], 'message': "net: explicitly set mac on linux bridge

The default behavior on a linux bridge is to use the lowest mac of
all attached interface. This isn't a problem when the bridge is first
set up, because the bridged interface is the only interface attached.
But, when instance interfaces are attached, there is a chance a lower
mac could be assigned and the bridge will switch macs. This patch
always sets the mac on the bridge to the mac of the bridged interface.

Change-Id: Ibf5333516a4c5487a3ee7c662e07028789bdd286
Closes-bug: #1488686
"}]
commit_message:
net: explicitly set mac on linux bridge

The default behavior on a linux bridge is to use the lowest mac of
all attached interface. This isn't a problem when the bridge is first
set up, because the bridged interface is the only interface attached.
But, when instance interfaces are attached, there is a chance a lower
mac could be assigned and the bridge will switch macs. This patch
always sets the mac on the bridge to the mac of the bridged interface.

Change-Id: Ibf5333516a4c5487a3ee7c662e07028789bdd286
Closes-bug: #1488686

Add image name option to bm boot config

In order to be able configure bm deploy with various images,
option --deploy-kernel and --deploy-ramdisk were added to baremetal boot
config command.

Closes-Bug: rhbz#1249836

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-09-17 15:55:17.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/v1/overcloud_deploy.py'], 'message': 'Stop false positive validation warning

Per rhbz#1260776, deployments that didn't specify flavors per role (not
using --compute-flavor flags) would have a false warning about "nodes
with no profile that will not be used." This commit prevents that
warning from showing up when no flavor arguments are provided.

Change-Id: Id6b9dcd881f1b45e64022e9ad4ed13a3dd648674
'}]
commit_message:
Stop false positive validation warning

Per rhbz#1260776, deployments that didn't specify flavors per role (not
using --compute-flavor flags) would have a false warning about "nodes
with no profile that will not be used." This commit prevents that
warning from showing up when no flavor arguments are provided.

Change-Id: Id6b9dcd881f1b45e64022e9ad4ed13a3dd648674

providing it as part of our centos repository. This change adds socat to
the requirements-rpm.txt

Fix checking of available nodes

When deploying/scaling nodes, deployment nodes count was checked
against available nodes in ironic instead of all nodes (including
already used nodes).

Closes-Bug: rhbz#1260991

subject: Fix gate (caused by devstack using clouds.yaml)
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-09-22 23:04:38.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/redstack'], 'message': "Fix gate (caused by devstack using clouds.yaml)

devstack recently changed upload_image to use the clouds.yaml file
instead of tokens.  This caused redstack to break in the gate as the
file is written by devstack in the user's home directory.  Redstack
changes the home directory, so the file isn't found.

Added a call to create the file so it's available for the gate job.

Change-Id: Ia541930a5cb99068434fc41ade92efc8c383455f
Closes-Bug: #1498626
"}]
commit_message:
Fix gate (caused by devstack using clouds.yaml)

devstack recently changed upload_image to use the clouds.yaml file
instead of tokens.  This caused redstack to break in the gate as the
file is written by devstack in the user's home directory.  Redstack
changes the home directory, so the file isn't found.

Added a call to create the file so it's available for the gate job.

Change-Id: Ia541930a5cb99068434fc41ade92efc8c383455f
Closes-Bug: #1498626

subject: Add support for pickling enginefacade context objects
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-09-22 17:46:06.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_db/tests/sqlalchemy/test_enginefacade.py', 'oslo_db/sqlalchemy/enginefacade.py'], 'message': 'Add support for pickling enginefacade context objects

In order to pickle a context object which refers
to an active _TransactionContextTLocal, we have to
use __reduce__ so that no database, engine, or session
state is pickled, and only a constructor remains.  Upon
unpickling, the constructor will install a new, empty
_TransactionContextTLocal on the new context, as is
appropriate since this is a totally different context object
than the original one.

Change-Id: Ia50cf10ff91a013ee24773c095a3df69ae06847b
'}]
commit_message:
Add support for pickling enginefacade context objects

In order to pickle a context object which refers
to an active _TransactionContextTLocal, we have to
use __reduce__ so that no database, engine, or session
state is pickled, and only a constructor remains.  Upon
unpickling, the constructor will install a new, empty
_TransactionContextTLocal on the new context, as is
appropriate since this is a totally different context object
than the original one.

Change-Id: Ia50cf10ff91a013ee24773c095a3df69ae06847b

subject: Allow empty lookup attributes if node_not_found_hook is provided
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-21 13:26:06.000000000', 'files': ['ironic_inspector/introspect.py', 'ironic_inspector/test/test_introspect.py'], 'message': 'Allow empty lookup attributes if node_not_found_hook is provided

An operator might choose to completely replace our lookup with
a custom one, so we should not enforce even one attribute in this case.
If node is not found even using the hook, we will fail later.

Closes-Bug: #1497237
Change-Id: I61382fcff043c1f7388878ada459a157bd4f39fe
'}]
commit_message:
Allow empty lookup attributes if node_not_found_hook is provided

An operator might choose to completely replace our lookup with
a custom one, so we should not enforce even one attribute in this case.
If node is not found even using the hook, we will fail later.

Closes-Bug: #1497237
Change-Id: I61382fcff043c1f7388878ada459a157bd4f39fe

commit_message:
Eliminate DB reads in internal DNS integration

The queries to the DB executed by the internal DNS integration code in the DB
plugin are eliminated. The work done by the pluggable IPAM backends is re-used
to support internal DNS integration.

Change-Id: Ica661183274966abd2776fbf4139034d3b5d0d18
Closes-Bug: #1497450

commit_message:
Add missing plugins for introspection rules

Conditions:
* in-net: checks if address is in a network

Actions:
* set-capability: sets a capability
* extend-attribute: append value to a list attibute

Helper method NodeInfo.replace_field is added to simplify writing
similar action plugins.

Implements: blueprint rules
Change-Id: I7e47b3500624df1f2cb15445d05e1c9bca6dc9ae

subject: Make test_revoke_cert_project_not_found_chdir_fails deterministic
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 782, 'name': 'John Garbutt', 'email': 'john.garbutt@stackhpc.com', 'username': 'johngarbutt'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 5441, 'name': 'Andrew Laski', 'email': 'andrew@lascii.com', 'username': 'alaski'}, {'_account_id': 8213, 'name': 'Claudiu Belu', 'email': 'claudiu.belu@canonical.com', 'username': 'claudiub'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15751, 'name': 'Intel PCI CI', 'email': 'pci-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intelpcici', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-14 16:09:32.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/test_crypto.py'], 'message': "Make test_revoke_cert_project_not_found_chdir_fails deterministic

Commit b64cebe2eb71a6c2275f6af76839a0b36cf56cbd removed the mock on
os.chdir to always fail with OSError in the test.

The revoke_cert method is using the ca_folder method to get the path and
that checks CONF.use_project_ca which is by default False, so the
project_id isn't even used in the path we're changing to before running
the command, it just uses the global static CONF.ca_path.  If that path
exists when this test runs, os.chdir won't raise OSError and the
assertion in the test will fail.

This change makes the test deterministic by (1) setting
use_project_ca=True and (2) using a random project_id uuid.

Closes-Bug: #1495547

Change-Id: I0dc6574b6644aa09028a07503a3d0b82e68e69d2
"}]
commit_message:
Make test_revoke_cert_project_not_found_chdir_fails deterministic

Commit b64cebe2eb71a6c2275f6af76839a0b36cf56cbd removed the mock on
os.chdir to always fail with OSError in the test.

The revoke_cert method is using the ca_folder method to get the path and
that checks CONF.use_project_ca which is by default False, so the
project_id isn't even used in the path we're changing to before running
the command, it just uses the global static CONF.ca_path.  If that path
exists when this test runs, os.chdir won't raise OSError and the
assertion in the test will fail.

This change makes the test deterministic by (1) setting
use_project_ca=True and (2) using a random project_id uuid.

Closes-Bug: #1495547

Change-Id: I0dc6574b6644aa09028a07503a3d0b82e68e69d2

commit_message:
Add some devref for AZs

Since the AZ knowledge is mostly tribal and can have some corner cases, we could
help the operators by giving more visibility on how it's made and what to prevent.

The related ticket mentioned below is one example of a common mistake that is
quite not easily fixable from the Nova standpoint since the design is mostly broken.

Change-Id: I092c8caa9e450a68a7a952940b0bb288b8fe6fb0
Related-Bug: #1444841

commit_message:
Juno: Release python-ceilometerclient 1.0.15

This contains the g-r sync for stable/juno so that oslo.utils is
capped in python-ceilometerclient.

Note that we can't release this until global-requirements on
stable/kilo are adjusted so kilo doesn't pick up the 1.0.15 version.

Depends-On: I81409216c895fbf640bb0e9f3d772f09cd7052ca

Change-Id: I28d1b319cf5fe36c64e7b9f8a8ced67b072f660a
Closes-Bug: #1494516

The previous patch sets the stage for tracking resources when doing
evacuate, but we still have to make sure that
_update_usage_from_migration actually does the update of the resources.
To do that we have to make sure we are getting the right flavor in case
of 'evacuation' migration, and also that we are not completely skipping
over it.

Once that's done claims and resource tracking work as expected when

DocImpact

Related-bug: #1417667
"}]
commit_message:
RT: track evacuation migrations

The previous patch sets the stage for tracking resources when doing
evacuate, but we still have to make sure that
_update_usage_from_migration actually does the update of the resources.
To do that we have to make sure we are getting the right flavor in case
of 'evacuation' migration, and also that we are not completely skipping
over it.

Once that's done claims and resource tracking work as expected when
evacuating instances.

DocImpact

Change-Id: Ie74939e543155bc42705b28e1b44d943ef54ebdc
Related-bug: #1417667

commit_message:
Update OSSN-0033 to include lp 1436082

VMWare and HTTP stores do not verify HTTPS Connections as they use
httplib.HTTPSConnection. This should also be included in this OSSN.

Change-Id: I80548762acaf8e2b3348682c7f49062adcf4b84b
Relates-Bug: 1436082

report_root is being called in the case of a new instance being
created from backup when root is enabled on the originating instance.
A change [1] was made that added the context object to the report_root
argument list and the Mongo guest wasn't passing it.

Closes-bug: 1498568
"}]
commit_message:
Fix Mongo report_root call to have correct args

report_root is being called in the case of a new instance being
created from backup when root is enabled on the originating instance.
A change [1] was made that added the context object to the report_root
argument list and the Mongo guest wasn't passing it.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/124355/

Change-Id: Id61337ae85fb980752d606bddb2f1e574a345cba
Closes-bug: 1498568

subject: Remove the unused scaleup command
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-15 10:24:59.000000000', 'files': ['tripleo_common/tests/test_scale.py', 'tripleo_common/scale.py'], 'message': 'Remove the unused scaleup command

This scaleup command was originally introduced to fill a gap missing in
python-tripleoclient (python-rdomanager-oscplugin at the time) but was never
removed when it gained the ability to scale up.

This implementation is limited because it assumes Tuskar and will fail in the
case of a more general Heat stack.

Change-Id: I980ca5ed50202b2d1b63a5c7505ccd7a5cc3d50a
'}]
commit_message:
Remove the unused scaleup command

This scaleup command was originally introduced to fill a gap missing in
python-tripleoclient (python-rdomanager-oscplugin at the time) but was never
removed when it gained the ability to scale up.

This implementation is limited because it assumes Tuskar and will fail in the
case of a more general Heat stack.

Change-Id: I980ca5ed50202b2d1b63a5c7505ccd7a5cc3d50a

subject: [Metering] Avoid using mutable in method defaults
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-09-16 19:45:36.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/utils/metering.py'], 'message': '[Metering] Avoid using mutable in method defaults

Currently mutable additional_query is updated because
it is initialized in method defaults, it may cause invalid
timestamp queries to ceilometer api.
In this CR this behavior is fixed.

Change-Id: I94afcdb90cc6cee03c18d57abbfcbd1c2617dd20
Closes-bug: #1496539
'}]
commit_message:
[Metering] Avoid using mutable in method defaults

Currently mutable additional_query is updated because
it is initialized in method defaults, it may cause invalid
timestamp queries to ceilometer api.
In this CR this behavior is fixed.

Change-Id: I94afcdb90cc6cee03c18d57abbfcbd1c2617dd20
Closes-bug: #1496539

subject: Don't send default environment file on pkg update or scale
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4257, 'name': 'Zane Bitter', 'email': 'zbitter@redhat.com', 'username': 'zaneb'}, {'_account_id': 4328, 'name': 'Steven Hardy', 'email': 'steven.hardy@suse.com', 'username': 'shardy'}, {'_account_id': 9712, 'name': 'Dougal Matthews', 'email': 'dougal.matthews@canonical.com', 'username': 'dougal'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-09-22 18:30:11.000000000', 'files': ['tripleo_common/tests/test_scale.py', 'tripleo_common/scale.py', 'tripleo_common/tests/test_update.py', 'tripleo_common/update.py'], 'message': 'Don't send default environment file on pkg update or scale

With the improvements for bug 1224828 in Liberty, Heat now remembers the
stack's environment so there is no need to pass all environment files on
every update of overcloud.

Since user can now omit all the '-e' arguments on update operations
we also should not send the "basic" resource registry environment
file either because if only this file is passed on update operation
(without all the extra env files passed on create), it may cause that
resource_registry for some resources will be changed which causes
that existing resources are being replaced with new ones.

Change-Id: Ife06c2918da0af3839d8ad69ff9202b7ff40f2e5
Related-to: I2e2da03e6a36f3bc46bb608350e11f5431e0fcff
Closes-Bug: #1498607
'}]
commit_message:
Don't send default environment file on pkg update or scale

With the improvements for bug 1224828 in Liberty, Heat now remembers the
stack's environment so there is no need to pass all environment files on
every update of overcloud.

Since user can now omit all the '-e' arguments on update operations
we also should not send the "basic" resource registry environment
file either because if only this file is passed on update operation
(without all the extra env files passed on create), it may cause that
resource_registry for some resources will be changed which causes
that existing resources are being replaced with new ones.

Change-Id: Ife06c2918da0af3839d8ad69ff9202b7ff40f2e5
Related-to: I2e2da03e6a36f3bc46bb608350e11f5431e0fcff
Closes-Bug: #1498607

commit_message:
Redirect all but cobbler and api from port 80

Redirect almost all from port 80 to port 8443 with SSL. Exclusions:
* API still have redirected to port 8000.
* Cobbler still uses port 80.

Change-Id: I872bb1c29df4b4775166944db7941296b352d93c
Closes-Bug: #1497397

commit_message:
Only get host data for floating ips on DVR routers

First, we are only interested in setting the host attribute when
the router is a DVR router.  Second, we don't need to query all of
the ports on the host, we just need to query the ports that are
referenced by the set of floating ips that we already have.

Closes-bug: #1496974
Change-Id: If611de14b2ab77d2eb9ce8c5b307ea6dd4403fe1

commit_message:
Minor keymaster cleanup

Refactor'd some code.  Also, removed the logging of the 'key ids' in
'fetch_crypto_keys' as we no longer maintain the key ids, rather all we have at
this point is the real keys themselves, and probably not much point in logging
those.

subject: Change fake_footers to replace response headers instead of append
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-09-22 19:33:43.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/middleware/fake_footers.py'], 'message': "Change fake_footers to replace response headers instead of append

This patch changes fake_footers to replace response headers so
that there will not be duplicate 'keys'.  The response headers are
a list of tuples, rather than a dict.  So simply appending can
result in duplicates.  This case should not occur, but has before.
An error log statement has been added if there would have been
a duplicate header key added.

Change-Id: I4dcd071756bd6298e7ce41642142ebb6a062d906
"}]
commit_message:
Change fake_footers to replace response headers instead of append

This patch changes fake_footers to replace response headers so
that there will not be duplicate 'keys'.  The response headers are
a list of tuples, rather than a dict.  So simply appending can
result in duplicates.  This case should not occur, but has before.
An error log statement has been added if there would have been
a duplicate header key added.

Change-Id: I4dcd071756bd6298e7ce41642142ebb6a062d906

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-09-15 21:40:10.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/redstack.rc', 'scripts/localrc.rc'], 'message': 'Fix install - update list of oslo libraries

devstack now validates that libraries installed using LIBS_FROM_GIT are
actually installed correctly.  This is causing install to fail with an
error:

[ERROR] /home/ubuntu/devstack/inc/python:178 The following LIBS_FROM_GIT
were not installed correct: python-ceilometerclient python-saharaclient
cookiecutter oslo-cookiecutter oslosphinx oslotest oslo.version
pylockfile hacking pyCADF

The happens because the list of oslo libraries in localrc.rc is out of
date and needed updating.  This has been done.

The Sahara client library is also not installed by devstack anymore, and
was removed.

The default flag to load libraries and clients from git was switched to
false as well, to insulate from further changes.  These can be turned
on again using either options.rc or ~/.redstack.options.rc where needed.

Change-Id: I365f99356dd03562c30f674b843322ae5a2f0a6a
Closes-Bug: #1496104'}]
commit_message:
Fix install - update list of oslo libraries

devstack now validates that libraries installed using LIBS_FROM_GIT are
actually installed correctly.  This is causing install to fail with an
error:

[ERROR] /home/ubuntu/devstack/inc/python:178 The following LIBS_FROM_GIT
were not installed correct: python-ceilometerclient python-saharaclient
cookiecutter oslo-cookiecutter oslosphinx oslotest oslo.version
pylockfile hacking pyCADF

The happens because the list of oslo libraries in localrc.rc is out of
date and needed updating.  This has been done.

The Sahara client library is also not installed by devstack anymore, and
was removed.

The default flag to load libraries and clients from git was switched to
false as well, to insulate from further changes.  These can be turned
on again using either options.rc or ~/.redstack.options.rc where needed.

Change-Id: I365f99356dd03562c30f674b843322ae5a2f0a6a
Closes-Bug: #1496104

commit_message:
Add support for extended_properties for clusters

During cluster creation, we are now able to pass in custom
properties specific to a datastore as part of a data-bag
named 'extended_properties'. This allows us to get these
properties to the appropriate clustering strategy which can
then use them to implement datastore specific actions.

Change-Id: If24f5bf6181bf1502042ac51868a161a6a037bf2

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-09-22 20:00:03.000000000', 'files': ['stack.sh'], 'message': "Revert change I2f8ae86e17d26ec4defa16e843faa8987d27fac9

The commit breaks creation of user rc file.
Now devstack doesn't create certificate for user
(because it's too early to do it) and doesn't react
to changes of EC2/S3 urls if they is recreated by devstack plugins.
So the commit totally broke ec2-api gating for example.

Change-Id: I069f46f95656655ae7ba8f3dd929f47eae594b68
"}]
commit_message:
Revert change I2f8ae86e17d26ec4defa16e843faa8987d27fac9

The commit breaks creation of user rc file.
Now devstack doesn't create certificate for user
(because it's too early to do it) and doesn't react
to changes of EC2/S3 urls if they is recreated by devstack plugins.
So the commit totally broke ec2-api gating for example.

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-18 05:44:27.000000000', 'files': ['senlin/engine/service.py', 'senlin/engine/actions/node_action.py', 'senlin/tests/unit/engine/test_node.py', 'senlin/engine/node.py', 'senlin/tests/unit/engine/actions/test_node_action.py', 'senlin/tests/unit/engine/service/test_nodes.py'], 'message': 'Fix the logic of node creation with specified cluster

Currently, the relationship between node and cluster will not be

some properties of both node and cluster are incorrect after node
creation, .e.g desired_capacity and nodes of cluster, index and
cluster_id of node. This patch fixes this issue.

Change-Id: Idde95519105b2a3b0ee68e7e591a1fee052cfc3e

commit_message:
Fix the logic of node creation with specified cluster

Currently, the relationship between node and cluster will not be
established when node is created with a target cluster. Therefore,
some properties of both node and cluster are incorrect after node
creation, .e.g desired_capacity and nodes of cluster, index and
cluster_id of node. This patch fixes this issue.

Change-Id: Idde95519105b2a3b0ee68e7e591a1fee052cfc3e

revisions:
[{'number': 13, 'created': '2015-06-29 06:47:46.000000000', 'files': ['specs/liberty/approved/cpu-model-per-flavor-or-image.rst'], 'message': 'Allow specifying cpu model/features in flavor extra-specs or image metadata

An end-user may want to write high-performance software that depends on certain
CPU features (SSE4.2, AVX, AVX2, LZCNT, FMA, BMI, etc) being available.
Currently we only allow specifying the CPU model as part of the compute node
configuration, and there is no easy way to select hosts based on the CPU model.

APIImpact
Implements blueprint cpu-model-per-flavor-or-image

Change-Id: Ie0a2701976fef0ed6e365f60868070b489ce25bd
'}]
commit_message:
Allow specifying cpu model/features in flavor extra-specs or image metadata

An end-user may want to write high-performance software that depends on certain
CPU features (SSE4.2, AVX, AVX2, LZCNT, FMA, BMI, etc) being available.
Currently we only allow specifying the CPU model as part of the compute node
configuration, and there is no easy way to select hosts based on the CPU model.

APIImpact
Implements blueprint cpu-model-per-flavor-or-image

Change-Id: Ie0a2701976fef0ed6e365f60868070b489ce25bd

commit_message:
Add user_id info: add 'user_id' to REST os-simple-tenant-usage output

Purpose is to give tenants a bit more auditing capability as to which user
created and terminated instances. Add 'user_id' to os-simple-tenant-usage
REST output, then we could get the user auditing from the REST output.

APIImpact

blueprint: add-userid-into-tenant-usage
Change-Id: I29cb6f4ba52eaf8df699bf5e38c40c17f78c74aa

revisions:
[{'number': 29, 'created': '2015-09-22 16:41:50.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_rpcapi.py', 'nova/objects/service.py', 'nova/tests/unit/conductor/test_conductor.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute.py', 'nova/conductor/manager.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py', 'nova/compute/rpcapi.py', 'nova/compute/claims.py', 'nova/tests/unit/objects/test_service.py', 'nova/compute/resource_tracker.py'], 'message': "rebuild: RPC sends additional args and claims are done

If a migration record was created for an evacuation operation, we will
want to pass it over to the compute node. It will be required for
resource tracking, and we can avoid a round trip back to the conductor
by making it a part of the RPC call.

Also - if we called the scheduler, we also know the node of the chosen
host, and the limits set, and this information is needed for doing claims.

We also make sure that rebuild now uses claims and resource tracking.

There is a final piece of the puzzle missing, and that is the following
patch which actually makes resource tracker update it's resources based
on the evacuation records, and adds the relevant tests.

Related-bug: #1417667
Change-Id: I0233f964d8f294f0ffd9edcb16b1aaf93486177f
"}]
commit_message:
rebuild: RPC sends additional args and claims are done

If a migration record was created for an evacuation operation, we will
want to pass it over to the compute node. It will be required for
resource tracking, and we can avoid a round trip back to the conductor
by making it a part of the RPC call.

Also - if we called the scheduler, we also know the node of the chosen
host, and the limits set, and this information is needed for doing claims.

We also make sure that rebuild now uses claims and resource tracking.

There is a final piece of the puzzle missing, and that is the following
patch which actually makes resource tracker update it's resources based
on the evacuation records, and adds the relevant tests.

Related-bug: #1417667
Change-Id: I0233f964d8f294f0ffd9edcb16b1aaf93486177f

commit_message:
update event filter test to validate multiple trait args

in mongodb, we use to fail when more than 2 trait filters are given.
this test is to validate there is no regression. also, so it
can be backported.

commit_message:
Delete its corresponding history data when deleting an alarm

The history data of an alarm will still be stored in storage after the
alarm being deleted. that is easy to cause residue issue.

taken from: I5f6d7a1998104335079b7988e3d0b929b8854b28

Change-Id: I4ceb3de37640de6ba1534e70735410333810a488
Closes-Bug: #1476883

Change-Id: Ibb457fc16b64ead1acbf359531ecd79e624df8ab
'}]
commit_message:
Activate pep8 check that _ is imported

Remove the specification in tox.ini that _ is a builtin so that
it will no longer assume that _ does not need to be imported.
This helps ensure that the _ from i18n is used.

Activating this check did not flag any violations.

Change-Id: Ibb457fc16b64ead1acbf359531ecd79e624df8ab

subject: DO NOT MERGE: nova-compute GDB backtrace
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-24 17:37:12.000000000', 'files': ['files/debs/general', 'tools/worlddump.py'], 'message': "DO NOT MERGE: nova-compute GDB backtrace

In trying to figure out what nova-compute is doing when it hangs in the
multinode job, we now trigger a guru meditation report to see what is
going on. But nova-compute isn't responding to that when it hangs, so
the next step is to get a gdb backtrace.

Hopefully we will see bug #1462305 on this patch soon so I don't need a
dozen rechecks

Duplicate of I89ba5f11de86c769e7db10cb1e1faa6e0a369aed to increase the
odds of hitting bug 1462305

Change-Id: Ib7fbf62981b4f48e949e4d1122f9fa17b7f31e4e
Related-Bug: #1462305
"}]
commit_message:
DO NOT MERGE: nova-compute GDB backtrace

In trying to figure out what nova-compute is doing when it hangs in the
multinode job, we now trigger a guru meditation report to see what is
going on. But nova-compute isn't responding to that when it hangs, so
the next step is to get a gdb backtrace.

Hopefully we will see bug #1462305 on this patch soon so I don't need a
dozen rechecks

Duplicate of I89ba5f11de86c769e7db10cb1e1faa6e0a369aed to increase the
odds of hitting bug 1462305

Change-Id: Ib7fbf62981b4f48e949e4d1122f9fa17b7f31e4e
Related-Bug: #1462305

subject: Fix glance image upload in the gate
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-09-22 23:48:05.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/redstack'], 'message': "Fix glance image upload in the gate

Glance in devstack was recently updated to rely on clouds.yaml instead
of using tokens (change I7092fb10cbe243e091789134263fab081af0c7f4).

This caused redstack to break in the gate as the file is written by
devstack in the 'stack' user's home directory.

Fixed this by linking the file from the 'stack' user's actual home
directory to the jenkins user's home directory.

Closes-Bug: #1498626
Co-Authored-By: Nikhil Manchanda <SlickNik@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ida0aa155b1e1ec7b8e9fa73006d3db9a88ffea02
"}]
commit_message:
Fix glance image upload in the gate

Glance in devstack was recently updated to rely on clouds.yaml instead
of using tokens (change I7092fb10cbe243e091789134263fab081af0c7f4).

This caused redstack to break in the gate as the file is written by
devstack in the 'stack' user's home directory.

Fixed this by linking the file from the 'stack' user's actual home
directory to the jenkins user's home directory.

Closes-Bug: #1498626
Co-Authored-By: Nikhil Manchanda <SlickNik@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ida0aa155b1e1ec7b8e9fa73006d3db9a88ffea02

subject: Fix proxy handling of EC client disconnect
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 597, 'name': 'Pete Zaitcev', 'email': 'zaitcev@kotori.zaitcev.us', 'username': 'zaitcev'}, {'_account_id': 1179, 'name': 'Clay Gerrard', 'email': 'clay.gerrard@gmail.com', 'username': 'clay-gerrard'}, {'_account_id': 7233, 'name': 'Matthew Oliver', 'email': 'matt@oliver.net.au', 'username': 'mattoliverau'}, {'_account_id': 7479, 'name': 'paul luse', 'email': 'paul.e.luse@intel.com', 'username': 'peluse'}, {'_account_id': 7847, 'name': 'Alistair Coles', 'email': 'alistairncoles@gmail.com', 'username': 'acoles'}, {'_account_id': 13052, 'name': 'SwiftStack Cluster CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'swiftstack-cluster-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 13104, 'name': 'Minwoo Bae', 'email': 'minwoob@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'minwoob'}, {'_account_id': 15932, 'name': 'Bill Huber', 'email': 'wbhuber@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'wbhuber'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-09-22 19:19:22.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/proxy/test_server.py', 'swift/proxy/controllers/obj.py'], 'message': "Fix proxy handling of EC client disconnect

The ECObjectController was unconditionally sending down the frag archive
commit document after the client source stream terminated - even if the
client disconnected early.

We can detect early disconnect in two ways:

  1. Content-Length and not enough bytes_transfered

     When eventlet.wsgi is reading from a Content-Length body the
     readable returns the empty string and our iterable raises
     StopIteration - but we can check content-length against
     bytes_transfered and know if the client disconnected.

  2. Transfer-Encoding: chunked - w/o a 0\r\n\r\n

     When eventlet.wsgi is reading from a Transfer-Encoding: chunked
     body the socket read returns the empty string, eventlet.wsgi's
     chunked parser raises ValueError (which we translate to
     ChunkReadError*) and we know we know the client disconnected.

... if we detect either of these conditions the proxy should:

  1. *not* send down the commit document to object servers
  2. disconnect from backend servers
  3. log the client disconnect

Oddly the code on master was only messing up the first part.  Backend
connections were terminated (gracefully after the commit document), and
then the disconnect was being logged as 499.

So now we only send down the commit document on a successful complete
client HTTP request (either whole Content-Length, or clean
Transfer-Encoding: chunked 0\r\n\r\n).

 * To detect the early disconnect on Transfer-Encoding: chunked a new
swift.common.exceptions.ChunkReadError is used to translate
eventlet.wsgi's more general IOError and ValueErrors into something
more appropriate to catch and handle closer to our generic
ChunkReadTimeout handling.

Co-Author: Alistair Coles <alistair.coles@hp.com>
Closes-Bug: #1496205
Change-Id: I028a530aba82d50baa4ee1d05ddce18d4cce4e81
"}]
commit_message:
Fix proxy handling of EC client disconnect

The ECObjectController was unconditionally sending down the frag archive
commit document after the client source stream terminated - even if the
client disconnected early.

We can detect early disconnect in two ways:

  1. Content-Length and not enough bytes_transfered

     When eventlet.wsgi is reading from a Content-Length body the
     readable returns the empty string and our iterable raises
     StopIteration - but we can check content-length against
     bytes_transfered and know if the client disconnected.

  2. Transfer-Encoding: chunked - w/o a 0\r\n\r\n

     When eventlet.wsgi is reading from a Transfer-Encoding: chunked
     body the socket read returns the empty string, eventlet.wsgi's
     chunked parser raises ValueError (which we translate to
     ChunkReadError*) and we know we know the client disconnected.

... if we detect either of these conditions the proxy should:

  1. *not* send down the commit document to object servers
  2. disconnect from backend servers
  3. log the client disconnect

Oddly the code on master was only messing up the first part.  Backend
connections were terminated (gracefully after the commit document), and
then the disconnect was being logged as 499.

So now we only send down the commit document on a successful complete
client HTTP request (either whole Content-Length, or clean
Transfer-Encoding: chunked 0\r\n\r\n).

 * To detect the early disconnect on Transfer-Encoding: chunked a new
swift.common.exceptions.ChunkReadError is used to translate
eventlet.wsgi's more general IOError and ValueErrors into something
more appropriate to catch and handle closer to our generic
ChunkReadTimeout handling.

Co-Author: Alistair Coles <alistair.coles@hp.com>
Closes-Bug: #1496205
Change-Id: I028a530aba82d50baa4ee1d05ddce18d4cce4e81

commit_message:
Make Quobyte shares actually read-only when requested

The string `access_level` won't ever be equal to `ro` in Quobyte Driver.
Do the right thing:
retrieve the `access_level` value from the `access` dict and
compare the result, as most likely intended but incorrectly implemented
and not tested. Also add the missing test.

Closes-Bug: 1498401

Change-Id: I735e5d0c91b5c8b258f4aa3461731ff293784995

commit_message:
Make end-points discoverable via Ironic API

This commit makes the following API end-points
discoverable via Ironic API
1. '/v1/nodes/<uuid>/states'
2. '/v1/drivers/<driver-name>/properties'

API Micro version is bumped to v1.14 with this change.

Closes-Bug:#1311288
Closes-Bug: #1475744
Co-Authored-By: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ibc0013b8c09c80d90042bf12b31a54820b00b43c

'doc/install-guide/source/figures/installguidearch-nova-hw.svg'], 'message': '[install] Initial networking architecture changes

Implement initial networking architecture changes for Liberty
as follows:

1) Remove nova-network.
2) Develop architecture for provider networks with Linux
   bridge agent.
3) Develop architecture for self-service networks with
   Linux bridge agent.
4) Munge the neutron controller and network node configuration
   together.
5) Rejigger neutron to use the Linux bridge agent.
6) Restructure launch an instance content to account for
   two networking options.
7) Other restructuring as necessary to meet the primary
   goal.

For simplicity, both architectures require only two nodes,
each with two network interfaces, to deploy core OpenStack
services. Also, to address recurring issues about the lack
of support for connecting instances directly to the
public/external network, the self-service architecture
augments the provider networks architecture which allows
connection to both private and public networks.

Change-Id: Ie3ab9a15ebfe82c0ce54f709c87a66d7cc46db3f
Implements: blueprint installguide-liberty
'}]
commit_message:
[install] Initial networking architecture changes

Implement initial networking architecture changes for Liberty
as follows:

1) Remove nova-network.
2) Develop architecture for provider networks with Linux
   bridge agent.
3) Develop architecture for self-service networks with
   Linux bridge agent.
4) Munge the neutron controller and network node configuration
   together.
5) Rejigger neutron to use the Linux bridge agent.
6) Restructure launch an instance content to account for
   two networking options.
7) Other restructuring as necessary to meet the primary
   goal.

For simplicity, both architectures require only two nodes,
each with two network interfaces, to deploy core OpenStack
services. Also, to address recurring issues about the lack
of support for connecting instances directly to the
public/external network, the self-service architecture
augments the provider networks architecture which allows
connection to both private and public networks.

Change-Id: Ie3ab9a15ebfe82c0ce54f709c87a66d7cc46db3f
Implements: blueprint installguide-liberty

subject: Replace httplib import with six.moves.http_client
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-22 20:29:46.000000000', 'files': ['congress/tests/api/test_versions.py', 'congress/api/versions.py'], 'message': 'Replace httplib import with six.moves.http_client

The httplib module was renamed to http.client on Python 3. Replace
the import with six.moves.http_client to be compatible with Python 2
and Python 3.

This change was generated by the "six_moves" command of the tool
sixer.

Partially implements blueprint: support-python3
Change-Id: I6a00d3721b86155803d5dc567203f7a15b41c909
'}]
commit_message:
Replace httplib import with six.moves.http_client

The httplib module was renamed to http.client on Python 3. Replace
the import with six.moves.http_client to be compatible with Python 2
and Python 3.

This change was generated by the "six_moves" command of the tool
sixer.

Partially implements blueprint: support-python3
Change-Id: I6a00d3721b86155803d5dc567203f7a15b41c909

subject: Replace xrange() with six.moves.range
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-22 20:25:45.000000000', 'files': ['congress/datalog/materialized.py', 'congress/datalog/topdown.py', 'congress/datalog/unify.py', 'congress/datalog/compile.py', 'congress/policy_engines/agnostic.py', 'congress/datasources/benchmark_driver.py', 'congress/tests/datasources/test_neutron_driver.py', 'congress/datalog/database.py', 'congress/api/row_model.py', 'congress/datalog/builtin/congressbuiltin.py', 'congress/tests/test_benchmark_updates.py'], 'message': 'Replace xrange() with six.moves.range

xrange() was removed in Python 3. Replace it with six.moves.range().

Use six.moves.range() instead of six.moves.xrange() to have a code
looking like Python 3 on Python 2 too. IMHO it makes the code more
readable (and simpler).

Patch generated by the "xrange" operation of the tool sixer.

Partially implements blueprint: support-python3
Change-Id: Id69f21448c92eb08494f761edf96cbc741b70a28
'}]
commit_message:
Replace xrange() with six.moves.range

xrange() was removed in Python 3. Replace it with six.moves.range().

Use six.moves.range() instead of six.moves.xrange() to have a code
looking like Python 3 on Python 2 too. IMHO it makes the code more
readable (and simpler).

Patch generated by the "xrange" operation of the tool sixer.

Partially implements blueprint: support-python3
Change-Id: Id69f21448c92eb08494f761edf96cbc741b70a28

subject: Fix usage of dict methods on Python 3
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-22 20:28:02.000000000', 'files': ['congress/datalog/ruleset.py', 'congress/datasources/cloudfoundryv2_driver.py', 'congress/tests/test_benchmark_updates.py'], 'message': 'Fix usage of dict methods on Python 3

Replace "dict.keys()+..." with "list(dict.keys())+...". Replace also
dict.items()[0] with list(dict.items())[0]. On Python 3, the keys()
and items() methods of a dictionary return an iterator, not a list.

Patch generated by the "dict_add" and "dict0" operations of the tool sixer.

Partially implements blueprint: support-python3
Change-Id: I189c62b04a0590189a774154af298f9094d83ff2
'}]
commit_message:
Fix usage of dict methods on Python 3

Replace "dict.keys()+..." with "list(dict.keys())+...". Replace also
dict.items()[0] with list(dict.items())[0]. On Python 3, the keys()
and items() methods of a dictionary return an iterator, not a list.

Patch generated by the "dict_add" and "dict0" operations of the tool sixer.

Partially implements blueprint: support-python3
Change-Id: I189c62b04a0590189a774154af298f9094d83ff2

commit_message:
Update hacking to version 0.10

hacking 0.10 is required to not complain on the line
"from six.moves import range". Such line will be used to ease the
addition of Python 3 support to Congress.

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-09-22 23:46:25.000000000', 'files': ['senlin/engine/service.py', 'senlin/tests/unit/engine/service/test_webhooks.py'], 'message': 'Add LOGs to engine service entry points

This patch adds logging to engine service entry points. The intent is to
make sure every service has a trace record in log. We will need to

Change-Id: Iab35852b3d5c258bc1e66c8fbed780afdcdfc625
'}]
commit_message:
Add LOGs to engine service entry points

This patch adds logging to engine service entry points. The intent is to
make sure every service has a trace record in log. We will need to
decide which ones from these logging calls should be replaced using event
calls later on.

Change-Id: Iab35852b3d5c258bc1e66c8fbed780afdcdfc625

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-22 11:32:59.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/hieradata/compute.yaml'], 'message': 'Remove default_floating_pool in compute.yaml

This is unused on compute nodes and does not need to be specified.

Further, nova::api is not even included in the compute puppet manifest,
so it had no effect anyway.

Change-Id: I7589bf544fb1ddad3cd371869756cb880c0bac37
'}]
commit_message:
Remove default_floating_pool in compute.yaml

This is unused on compute nodes and does not need to be specified.

Further, nova::api is not even included in the compute puppet manifest,
so it had no effect anyway.

Change-Id: I7589bf544fb1ddad3cd371869756cb880c0bac37

[{'number': 20, 'created': '2015-09-22 10:34:01.000000000', 'files': ['sahara/service/heat/templates.py', 'sahara/tests/unit/service/heat/test_templates.py', 'sahara/plugins/provisioning.py'], 'message': 'Add wait condition for heat templates

Heat supports wait condition for reporting signals.
We use wait condition for getting status of VM.
If VM send signal to Heat this is means that VM booted and accessible
via SSH.

implements bp: sahara-heat-wait-conditions

Change-Id: I6f0b52840359bb46144b31fee245f0c104f1686e
'}]
commit_message:
Add wait condition for heat templates

Heat supports wait condition for reporting signals.
We use wait condition for getting status of VM.
If VM send signal to Heat this is means that VM booted and accessible
via SSH.

implements bp: sahara-heat-wait-conditions

Change-Id: I6f0b52840359bb46144b31fee245f0c104f1686e
