subject: Prevent image status being directly modified via v1
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 455, 'name': 'Stuart McLaren', 'email': 'stuart.mclaren@hpe.com', 'username': 'stuart-mclaren'}, {'_account_id': 2537, 'name': 'Nikhil Komawar', 'email': 'nik.komawar@gmail.com', 'username': 'nikhil-komawar'}, {'_account_id': 6159, 'name': 'Flavio Percoco Premoli', 'display_name': 'flaper87', 'email': 'flavio.percoco@flyrlabs.com', 'username': 'flaper87'}, {'_account_id': 9311, 'name': 'Tristan Cacqueray', 'email': 'tdecacqu@redhat.com', 'username': 'tristanC'}, {'_account_id': 11391, 'name': 'Mikhail Fedosin', 'email': 'mfedosin@redhat.com', 'username': 'fedosinme'}, {'_account_id': 14676, 'name': 'Kairat Kushaev', 'email': 'kkushaev@mirantis.com', 'username': 'kairat_kushaev'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-09-22 19:20:40.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt', 'glance/api/v1/__init__.py', 'glance/api/v1/images.py', 'glance/tests/functional/v1/test_api.py', 'glance/tests/integration/legacy_functional/test_v1_api.py'], 'message': "Prevent image status being directly modified via v1

Users shouldn't be able to change an image's status directly via the
v1 API.

Some existing consumers of Glance set the x-image-meta-status header in
requests to the Glance API, eg:

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/plugins/xenserver/xenapi/etc/xapi.d/plugins/glance#L184

We should try to prevent users setting 'status' via v1, but without breaking
existing benign API calls such as these.

I've adopted the following approach (which has some prior art in 'protected properties').

If a PUT request is received which contains an x-image-meta-status header:

* The user provided status is ignored if it matches the current image
  status (this prevents benign calls such as the nova one above from
  breaking). The usual code (eg 200) will be returned.

* If the user provided status doesn't match the current image status (ie
  there is a real attempt to change the value) 403 will be returned. This
  will break any calls which currently intentionally change the status.

APIImpact

Closes-bug: 1482371

Change-Id: I44fadf32abb57c962b67467091c3f51c1ccc25e6
(cherry picked from commit 4d08db5b6d42323ac1958ef3b7417d875e7bea8c)
(cherry picked from commit 9beca533f42ae1fc87418de0c360e19bc59b24b5)
"}]
commit_message:
Prevent image status being directly modified via v1

Users shouldn't be able to change an image's status directly via the
v1 API.

Some existing consumers of Glance set the x-image-meta-status header in
requests to the Glance API, eg:

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/plugins/xenserver/xenapi/etc/xapi.d/plugins/glance#L184

We should try to prevent users setting 'status' via v1, but without breaking
existing benign API calls such as these.

I've adopted the following approach (which has some prior art in 'protected properties').

If a PUT request is received which contains an x-image-meta-status header:

* The user provided status is ignored if it matches the current image
  status (this prevents benign calls such as the nova one above from
  breaking). The usual code (eg 200) will be returned.

* If the user provided status doesn't match the current image status (ie
  there is a real attempt to change the value) 403 will be returned. This
  will break any calls which currently intentionally change the status.

APIImpact

Closes-bug: 1482371

Change-Id: I44fadf32abb57c962b67467091c3f51c1ccc25e6
(cherry picked from commit 4d08db5b6d42323ac1958ef3b7417d875e7bea8c)
(cherry picked from commit 9beca533f42ae1fc87418de0c360e19bc59b24b5)

commit_message:
automatically submit constraints updates for new releases

Refactor the repository management code a bit to make it possible to
reuse the logic, then add a step at the end of the script to update
upper-constraints.txt in the requirements project for the new release.

Change-Id: Icce3c979a5196dafe78998d2de700099109cecea

Also add enabling debug where lost it.
Also add .with_all_deps if required

commit_message:
Add a NullHandler to all of our loggers

As a library, it's important to make sure our logging is set up to not
be confusing, but also to not to step on the toes of app developers.

https://docs.python.org/3.1/library/logging.html#configuring-logging-for-a-library

Change-Id: I312871e057ca0f64b9c5514bc94567cbdb34b4c6

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-22 09:56:14.000000000', 'files': ['diskimage-create/diskimage-create.sh'], 'message': 'diskimage-create.sh: add and use image_create

Introduce an helper function to wrap the disk-image-create invocation,
so it is possible to factor out all the common elements, arguments, and
environment variables for all the images.

Current common elements are:
- vm & ntp (already used for all the images)
- xfs-tools (previously not used in ambari images, but should not be an
  huge overhead)
- sahara-version (so all the images have the version information of
  dib-utils, diskimage-builder, and sahara-image-elements)

image_create also does mirror and debug handling for all the images, and
takes care of setting the centos6 cloud image.

Apply image_create instead of invoking disk-image-create, cleaning up
the list of elements, and the environment variables set.

Change-Id: If0e94193383cfa0f4d793353f469ffc4b5d37cab
'}]
commit_message:
diskimage-create.sh: add and use image_create

Introduce an helper function to wrap the disk-image-create invocation,
so it is possible to factor out all the common elements, arguments, and
environment variables for all the images.

Current common elements are:
- vm & ntp (already used for all the images)
- xfs-tools (previously not used in ambari images, but should not be an
  huge overhead)
- sahara-version (so all the images have the version information of
  dib-utils, diskimage-builder, and sahara-image-elements)

image_create also does mirror and debug handling for all the images, and
takes care of setting the centos6 cloud image.

Apply image_create instead of invoking disk-image-create, cleaning up
the list of elements, and the environment variables set.

Change-Id: If0e94193383cfa0f4d793353f469ffc4b5d37cab

subject: Put staticweb middleware after keystoneauth in proxy pipeline
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-09-22 20:34:08.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/hieradata/controller.yaml'], 'message': 'Put staticweb middleware after keystoneauth in proxy pipeline

The staticweb middleware needs to be put after authentication
middlewares to ensure correct functionality as documented in
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/swift/middleware.html#staticweb

Without this Swift sends a HTML response even if the request was done
using a X-Auth-Token. This might result in a faulty handling of the response on
the client side; for example, "swift stat containername" would report an empty,
private container, while the container might actually be public readable with
data stored in it.

Closes-bug: 1494896
Change-Id: Id48840e0041f8d272e08def292fbedfaf76bbfbb
Co-Authored-By: Christian Schwede <cschwede@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Put staticweb middleware after keystoneauth in proxy pipeline

The staticweb middleware needs to be put after authentication
middlewares to ensure correct functionality as documented in
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/swift/middleware.html#staticweb

Without this Swift sends a HTML response even if the request was done
using a X-Auth-Token. This might result in a faulty handling of the response on
the client side; for example, "swift stat containername" would report an empty,
private container, while the container might actually be public readable with
data stored in it.

Closes-bug: 1494896
Change-Id: Id48840e0041f8d272e08def292fbedfaf76bbfbb
Co-Authored-By: Christian Schwede <cschwede@redhat.com>

subject: Remove many redundant debug logs
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-09-22 20:46:29.000000000', 'files': ['shade/__init__.py'], 'message': 'Remove many redundant debug logs

Now that shade stores inner exceptions in the OpenStackCloudException
constructor and logs them, there is no need for logging the same
exceptions at debug level in the library.

This patch removes all such log entries that appear to add no additional
information beyond what is in the exception.  Many messages remain
which add information not in the exception -- their accompanying
exceptions should be updated and then the extraneous log lines
should be removed.

Change-Id: Idcdbfa77c68260d171e78f6ada4ee5a46518061c
'}]
commit_message:
Remove many redundant debug logs

Now that shade stores inner exceptions in the OpenStackCloudException
constructor and logs them, there is no need for logging the same
exceptions at debug level in the library.

This patch removes all such log entries that appear to add no additional
information beyond what is in the exception.  Many messages remain
which add information not in the exception -- their accompanying
exceptions should be updated and then the extraneous log lines
should be removed.

Change-Id: Idcdbfa77c68260d171e78f6ada4ee5a46518061c

commit_message:
ml2: don't consider drivers with no bind_port for qos supported rule types

If the driver is not going to bind a port, we should not use it as
justification to limit the subset of rule types available for the user.

The most common scenario for that would be l2pop, that does not handle port
binding, but merely modifies the implementation details of node
interconnection.

Change-Id: Iba0f3530deff3bb2871ebf893c43ef628a80c7c0
Closes-Bug: #1488996

commit_message:
Adds vm generation and destroy nic utils

The methods are needed in order to be able to attach and
detach vNICs to existing VMs.

Co-Authored-By: Adelina Tuvenie <atuvenie@cloudbasesolutions.com>

subject: update RST for readme so pypi looks pretty
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-22 21:21:03.000000000', 'files': ['README.rst'], 'message': 'update RST for readme so pypi looks pretty

Navigating to https://pypi.python.org/pypi/os-client-config results
in seeing the raw RST content of the readme file. This is likely
caused by minor RST warnings, but pypi gives up and shows it raw.

Change-Id: Ia2d6202ade5282d9aeae9bb948175aae2aa264cd
'}]
commit_message:
update RST for readme so pypi looks pretty

Navigating to https://pypi.python.org/pypi/os-client-config results
in seeing the raw RST content of the readme file. This is likely
caused by minor RST warnings, but pypi gives up and shows it raw.

Change-Id: Ia2d6202ade5282d9aeae9bb948175aae2aa264cd

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-09-17 10:02:50.000000000', 'files': ['reference/tags/index.rst', 'reference/tags/assert_follows-standard-deprecation.rst'], 'message': 'Introduce assert:follows-standard-deprecation tag

The assert:follows-standard-deprecation tag defines a standard
deprecation policy for user-visible and ops-visible features and
APIs in OpenStack services. Project teams may assert that they
follow at least this policy (and then commit to it).

This is an essential bit of information to communicate to our users,
and a key factor in assessing a given project maturity.

Co-Authored-By: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ic241e93e83422deaf971238a2049160b75bd0bf3

commit_message:
Introduce assert:follows-standard-deprecation tag

The assert:follows-standard-deprecation tag defines a standard
deprecation policy for user-visible and ops-visible features and
APIs in OpenStack services. Project teams may assert that they
follow at least this policy (and then commit to it).

This is an essential bit of information to communicate to our users,
and a key factor in assessing a given project maturity.

Co-Authored-By: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ic241e93e83422deaf971238a2049160b75bd0bf3

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2015-09-22 16:46:35.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/routers/tables.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/network_topology/views.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/networks/tables.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/networks/tests.py'], 'message': 'enable_quotas=False breaks Neutron usage

Excluding OPENSTACK_NEUTRON_NETWORK["enable_quotas"] or setting to False
will result in tenant_quota_usages building dictionaries which do not
contain the keys network,routers,subnets.

This will cause key errors anytime quotas['networks']['available'] is called.

* clarified helper method name
* simplified key check
* same logic for routers table
* network topology enabled quotas logic

Change-Id: I79bb1b09bcda59ab56800821cc3c65e72ed60060
Closes-Bug:#1483379
Related-Bug:#1482354
'}]
commit_message:
enable_quotas=False breaks Neutron usage

Excluding OPENSTACK_NEUTRON_NETWORK["enable_quotas"] or setting to False
will result in tenant_quota_usages building dictionaries which do not
contain the keys network,routers,subnets.

This will cause key errors anytime quotas['networks']['available'] is called.

* clarified helper method name
* simplified key check
* same logic for routers table
* network topology enabled quotas logic

Change-Id: I79bb1b09bcda59ab56800821cc3c65e72ed60060
Closes-Bug:#1483379
Related-Bug:#1482354

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 455, 'name': 'Stuart McLaren', 'email': 'stuart.mclaren@hpe.com', 'username': 'stuart-mclaren'}, {'_account_id': 2537, 'name': 'Nikhil Komawar', 'email': 'nik.komawar@gmail.com', 'username': 'nikhil-komawar'}, {'_account_id': 6159, 'name': 'Flavio Percoco Premoli', 'display_name': 'flaper87', 'email': 'flavio.percoco@flyrlabs.com', 'username': 'flaper87'}, {'_account_id': 11391, 'name': 'Mikhail Fedosin', 'email': 'mfedosin@redhat.com', 'username': 'fedosinme'}, {'_account_id': 14676, 'name': 'Kairat Kushaev', 'email': 'kkushaev@mirantis.com', 'username': 'kairat_kushaev'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-22 14:09:28.000000000', 'files': ['glance/api/v1/__init__.py', 'glance/api/v1/images.py', 'glance/tests/functional/v1/test_api.py', 'glance/tests/integration/legacy_functional/test_v1_api.py'], 'message': "Prevent image status being directly modified via v1

Users shouldn't be able to change an image's status directly via the
v1 API.

Some existing consumers of Glance set the x-image-meta-status header in
requests to the Glance API, eg:

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/plugins/xenserver/xenapi/etc/xapi.d/plugins/glance#L184

We should try to prevent users setting 'status' via v1, but without breaking
existing benign API calls such as these.

I've adopted the following approach (which has some prior art in 'protected properties').

If a PUT request is received which contains an x-image-meta-status header:

* The user provided status is ignored if it matches the current image
  status (this prevents benign calls such as the nova one above from
  breaking). The usual code (eg 200) will be returned.

* If the user provided status doesn't match the current image status (ie
  there is a real attempt to change the value) 403 will be returned. This
  will break any calls which currently intentionally change the status.

APIImpact

Closes-bug: 1482371

Change-Id: I44fadf32abb57c962b67467091c3f51c1ccc25e6
(cherry picked from commit 4d08db5b6d42323ac1958ef3b7417d875e7bea8c)
"}]
commit_message:
Prevent image status being directly modified via v1

Users shouldn't be able to change an image's status directly via the
v1 API.

Some existing consumers of Glance set the x-image-meta-status header in
requests to the Glance API, eg:

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/plugins/xenserver/xenapi/etc/xapi.d/plugins/glance#L184

We should try to prevent users setting 'status' via v1, but without breaking
existing benign API calls such as these.

I've adopted the following approach (which has some prior art in 'protected properties').

If a PUT request is received which contains an x-image-meta-status header:

* The user provided status is ignored if it matches the current image
  status (this prevents benign calls such as the nova one above from
  breaking). The usual code (eg 200) will be returned.

* If the user provided status doesn't match the current image status (ie
  there is a real attempt to change the value) 403 will be returned. This
  will break any calls which currently intentionally change the status.

APIImpact

Closes-bug: 1482371

Change-Id: I44fadf32abb57c962b67467091c3f51c1ccc25e6
(cherry picked from commit 4d08db5b6d42323ac1958ef3b7417d875e7bea8c)

subject: Change behavior of GET cas/preferred
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-09-22 18:07:00.000000000', 'files': ['barbican/tasks/certificate_resources.py', 'barbican/api/controllers/cas.py', 'functionaltests/api/v1/functional/test_cas.py'], 'message': 'Change behavior of GET cas/preferred

A user will want to know information about which CA has been assigned
to him by either the project admin or the system admin.
Get /cas/preferred will return the ref of either the project
preferred CA (set by /add-to-project) or the global preferred CA
(set by /set-global-preferred).
If the admins have not set a preferred CA, then 404 is returned.

Change-Id: I56e5d4d62e0b99c9151f25f0f395ffe7c3ad41d1
Partially-implements: blueprint add-cas
Closes-bug: #1498269
'}]
commit_message:
Change behavior of GET cas/preferred

A user will want to know information about which CA has been assigned
to him by either the project admin or the system admin.
Get /cas/preferred will return the ref of either the project
preferred CA (set by /add-to-project) or the global preferred CA
(set by /set-global-preferred).
If the admins have not set a preferred CA, then 404 is returned.

Change-Id: I56e5d4d62e0b99c9151f25f0f395ffe7c3ad41d1
Partially-implements: blueprint add-cas
Closes-bug: #1498269

Cache the manila service image

It can then be used locally by a follow-on patch to point to the
cached verioned by changing the url to a file://

https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/manila/tree/devstack/plugin.sh#n97

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-22 16:34:57.000000000', 'files': ['os_client_config/config.py'], 'message': 'Fix a little error with the None auth type

Ironic has a mode where it does not use auth, but we still funnel that
through the ksa admin_token type for consistency of code. The hack we
had to do that went too far and caused validate_auth to strip the fake
token we were adding.

Change-Id: Id5275ac7db1a6052db02c2286cbf88862cb1ff70
'}]
commit_message:
Fix a little error with the None auth type

Ironic has a mode where it does not use auth, but we still funnel that
through the ksa admin_token type for consistency of code. The hack we
had to do that went too far and caused validate_auth to strip the fake
token we were adding.

Change-Id: Id5275ac7db1a6052db02c2286cbf88862cb1ff70

commit_message:
Do not lose traceback while raising exc

It may have potentially useful info for debugging.

subject: FWaaS tests improving
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-15 13:41:55.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/firewalls/tests.py', 'openstack_dashboard/test/test_data/neutron_data.py'], 'message': 'FWaaS tests improving

There is a typo in neutron_data in the second firewall data,
which actually skip this data at all. This patch fixes the typo
and adds corresponding changes to consider this case.

Closes-Bug: #1495968

Change-Id: I9c2250c700c67ee6b6d8495b9347144dd304a3d3
'}]
commit_message:
FWaaS tests improving

There is a typo in neutron_data in the second firewall data,
which actually skip this data at all. This patch fixes the typo
and adds corresponding changes to consider this case.

Closes-Bug: #1495968

Change-Id: I9c2250c700c67ee6b6d8495b9347144dd304a3d3

revisions:
[{'number': 25, 'created': '2015-08-25 14:40:49.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/brick/local_dev/lvm.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/volume/flows/test_create_volume_flow.py', 'cinder/volume/flows/manager/create_volume.py', 'cinder/volume/manager.py', 'cinder/volume/driver.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_volume.py', 'cinder/image/glance.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/image/fake.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/brick/fake_lvm.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/lvm.py'], 'message': 'Efficient image transfer for Glance cinder store

This adds an implementation of clone_image which offloads
the image copy when the image is stored in Glance Cinder store.
It uses "create_clone_volume" method to create a new volume
from an image that is placed on a cinder volume.

To enable this feature, glance_api_version in cinder.conf must be
set to 2, and allowed_direct_url_schemes must contain 'cinder'.
In glance-api.conf, show_multiple_locations must be set to True.
Also the Cinder store must be enabled.

In addition, if image_upload_use_cinder_backend is set to True,
upload-to-image in raw format will create a cloned volume and
register its location to the image service.
If image_upload_use_internal_tenant is set to True, the image
volume is stored in the internal tenant. Otherwise it is placed
in the current context's tenant.

This also changes LVM driver implementation to enable
image upload. Especially for thin LVM, it modifies
create_cloned_volume method to create thin snapshot LV.
Note that the thin snapshot LV can be treated as the normal
LVs; it can be read/written and can survive after the parent
volume is deleted.

Only raw format image is supported. Otherwise, normal image
upload/download method is used.

Currently Glance Cinder store does not support upload and
download, so the image created by this feature cannot be used
by other projects than Cinder. Patches to provide access to
images stored on Cinder are proposed here:
  glance-specs: https://review.openstack.org/183363
  glance patch(adding rootwrap): https://review.openstack.org/186201
  glance_store patch: https://review.openstack.org/166414

Note that this change works even without Glance patches.

Change-Id: I2cb68749f194d0cd597b7258a317afb982236aea
Implements: blueprint clone-image-in-glance-cinder-backend
DocImpact
'}]
commit_message:
Efficient image transfer for Glance cinder store

This adds an implementation of clone_image which offloads
the image copy when the image is stored in Glance Cinder store.
It uses "create_clone_volume" method to create a new volume
from an image that is placed on a cinder volume.

To enable this feature, glance_api_version in cinder.conf must be
set to 2, and allowed_direct_url_schemes must contain 'cinder'.
In glance-api.conf, show_multiple_locations must be set to True.
Also the Cinder store must be enabled.

In addition, if image_upload_use_cinder_backend is set to True,
upload-to-image in raw format will create a cloned volume and
register its location to the image service.
If image_upload_use_internal_tenant is set to True, the image
volume is stored in the internal tenant. Otherwise it is placed
in the current context's tenant.

This also changes LVM driver implementation to enable
image upload. Especially for thin LVM, it modifies
create_cloned_volume method to create thin snapshot LV.
Note that the thin snapshot LV can be treated as the normal
LVs; it can be read/written and can survive after the parent
volume is deleted.

Only raw format image is supported. Otherwise, normal image
upload/download method is used.

Currently Glance Cinder store does not support upload and
download, so the image created by this feature cannot be used
by other projects than Cinder. Patches to provide access to
images stored on Cinder are proposed here:
  glance-specs: https://review.openstack.org/183363
  glance patch(adding rootwrap): https://review.openstack.org/186201
  glance_store patch: https://review.openstack.org/166414

Note that this change works even without Glance patches.

Change-Id: I2cb68749f194d0cd597b7258a317afb982236aea
Implements: blueprint clone-image-in-glance-cinder-backend
DocImpact

subject: Convert all internal commands to list
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-09-22 05:07:33.000000000', 'files': ['bin/cfn-signal', 'heat_cfntools/cfntools/cfn_helper.py', 'heat_cfntools/tests/test_cfn_helper.py'], 'message': 'Convert all internal commands to list

Make all internal commands as list to avoid any possibility of command
line injection. Commands supplied as string are susceptible to
substitution.

All the internal commands are supplied as list to CommandRunner. As a
convention, all the commands must be given as list to subprocess except
the commands read from file, like in case of cfn hooks and commands
section in metadata.

Few internal commands require shell redirects and they will be

Partial-Bug: #1312246
'}]
commit_message:
Convert all internal commands to list

Make all internal commands as list to avoid any possibility of command
line injection. Commands supplied as string are susceptible to
substitution.

All the internal commands are supplied as list to CommandRunner. As a
convention, all the commands must be given as list to subprocess except
the commands read from file, like in case of cfn hooks and commands
section in metadata.

Few internal commands require shell redirects and they will be
implemented in another patch.

Change-Id: Ifabaf44e341144bc85508dc05c76b1d83e41ae44
Partial-Bug: #1312246

commit_message:
Changes to Preferred CA Features

This commit contains the following updates related to preferred CAs

- GET /cas/preferred/ and GET /cas/global-preferred/ now return
  a ca_ref, instead of the CA object
- Functional tests are updated to receive that ref
- Update the functional tests to reset state with regards to preferred
  and project CAs (each test cleans up after self)
- Unskip tests that now pass
- Remove test case that incorrectly represented behavior of /preferred/
- Use hard delete instead of soft delete for preferred CAs

Partially-implements: blueprint add-cas
Change-Id: Ie3beb5c2bd7583626c1ffac088386b1a4d3dbb19

subject: Use seteuid instead of su to control privileges
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-09-22 04:06:44.000000000', 'files': ['heat_cfntools/cfntools/cfn_helper.py', 'heat_cfntools/tests/test_cfn_helper.py'], 'message': 'Use seteuid instead of su to control privileges

Control the privileges by setting the effective UID before running the
command. Earlier we used to run command using su -c "USER".

Original EUID is restored after running the command. This is required to
run multiple commands in succession with different run-as users.

Change-Id: I414fc6a802f11deb320b43c6d011f802a42c40c9
Partial-Bug: #1312246
'}]
commit_message:
Use seteuid instead of su to control privileges

Control the privileges by setting the effective UID before running the
command. Earlier we used to run command using su -c "USER".

Original EUID is restored after running the command. This is required to
run multiple commands in succession with different run-as users.

Change-Id: I414fc6a802f11deb320b43c6d011f802a42c40c9
Partial-Bug: #1312246

commit_message:
wip: make grenade smash resources harder

This makes the nova and cinder resource scripts create a number of
servers, not just one. The point of this is to try to repeatably
expose what I believe is a security group race by doing this a lot and
making it show up more often.

Should not be merged with the existing counters in here, though I
think there is some usefulness in leaving the paramatrized server
count.

Add worlddump all over the place to figure out what's going on.

Depends-On: Ib253537a54a1b9d83a930bbefa4512e039575fd1

Change-Id: I173b10bdd76449dee2219b265b7e74afe4ee101c

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-05 12:59:00.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/db/test_migrations.py'], 'message': "remove redundant migration tests

We've never had a bug where we told SQLA to make a table, and it
didn't but passed silently. At some point during oslo.db refactoring
and db migration compaction, the reason for the checks in
test_migrations got lost.

Remove the tests which are clearly not useful, and attempt to document
what useful testing looks like here. Many of the remaining checks are
a bit dubious, but at least this should reduce cargo culting of the
schema validation tests.

Change-Id: I97bf7117bd880a4327062a716776d8d7ded65a76
"}]
commit_message:
remove redundant migration tests

We've never had a bug where we told SQLA to make a table, and it
didn't but passed silently. At some point during oslo.db refactoring
and db migration compaction, the reason for the checks in
test_migrations got lost.

Remove the tests which are clearly not useful, and attempt to document
what useful testing looks like here. Many of the remaining checks are
a bit dubious, but at least this should reduce cargo culting of the
schema validation tests.

Change-Id: I97bf7117bd880a4327062a716776d8d7ded65a76

subject: Prevent image status being directly modified via v1
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 455, 'name': 'Stuart McLaren', 'email': 'stuart.mclaren@hpe.com', 'username': 'stuart-mclaren'}, {'_account_id': 2537, 'name': 'Nikhil Komawar', 'email': 'nik.komawar@gmail.com', 'username': 'nikhil-komawar'}, {'_account_id': 5314, 'name': 'Brian Rosmaita', 'email': 'rosmaita.fossdev@gmail.com', 'username': 'brian-rosmaita'}, {'_account_id': 6159, 'name': 'Flavio Percoco Premoli', 'display_name': 'flaper87', 'email': 'flavio.percoco@flyrlabs.com', 'username': 'flaper87'}, {'_account_id': 8158, 'name': 'Hemanth Makkapati', 'email': 'makstacker+osgerrit@gmail.com', 'username': 'hemanth.makkapati'}, {'_account_id': 11391, 'name': 'Mikhail Fedosin', 'email': 'mfedosin@redhat.com', 'username': 'fedosinme'}, {'_account_id': 14676, 'name': 'Kairat Kushaev', 'email': 'kkushaev@mirantis.com', 'username': 'kairat_kushaev'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-22 14:09:09.000000000', 'files': ['glance/api/v1/__init__.py', 'glance/api/v1/images.py', 'glance/tests/functional/v1/test_api.py', 'glance/tests/integration/legacy_functional/test_v1_api.py'], 'message': "Prevent image status being directly modified via v1

Users shouldn't be able to change an image's status directly via the
v1 API.

Some existing consumers of Glance set the x-image-meta-status header in
requests to the Glance API, eg:

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/plugins/xenserver/xenapi/etc/xapi.d/plugins/glance#L184

We should try to prevent users setting 'status' via v1, but without breaking
existing benign API calls such as these.

I've adopted the following approach (which has some prior art in 'protected properties').

If a PUT request is received which contains an x-image-meta-status header:

* The user provided status is ignored if it matches the current image
  status (this prevents benign calls such as the nova one above from
  breaking). The usual code (eg 200) will be returned.

* If the user provided status doesn't match the current image status (ie
  there is a real attempt to change the value) 403 will be returned. This
  will break any calls which currently intentionally change the status.

APIImpact

Closes-bug: 1482371

Change-Id: I44fadf32abb57c962b67467091c3f51c1ccc25e6
"}]
commit_message:
Prevent image status being directly modified via v1

Users shouldn't be able to change an image's status directly via the
v1 API.

Some existing consumers of Glance set the x-image-meta-status header in
requests to the Glance API, eg:

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/plugins/xenserver/xenapi/etc/xapi.d/plugins/glance#L184

We should try to prevent users setting 'status' via v1, but without breaking
existing benign API calls such as these.

I've adopted the following approach (which has some prior art in 'protected properties').

If a PUT request is received which contains an x-image-meta-status header:

* The user provided status is ignored if it matches the current image
  status (this prevents benign calls such as the nova one above from
  breaking). The usual code (eg 200) will be returned.

* If the user provided status doesn't match the current image status (ie
  there is a real attempt to change the value) 403 will be returned. This
  will break any calls which currently intentionally change the status.

APIImpact

Closes-bug: 1482371

Change-Id: I44fadf32abb57c962b67467091c3f51c1ccc25e6

commit_message:
Allow unsetting node.target_raid_config

Currently we have no mechanism to unset node.target_raid_config.
This should be possible because operators may decide to stop
using RAID on the bare metal after using it for a while.

Change-Id: Ifdb2017827a7962d353ae69e9b4fb24144e19f8e
Closes-Bug: 1498275

commit_message:
Update the examples used for the trusted_dashboard option

The code to check for a trusted dashboard host explicitly
checks for the path /auth/websso in addition to the hostname.

The documentations references this:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/keystone/federation/websso.html

But we should update the examples used in the sample config.

Change-Id: I595395dc780b3f54d396787678e9d24e5441ab1a

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-09-16 20:03:55.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/agent/discovery/endpoint.py', 'ceilometer/agent/discovery/tenant.py'], 'message': 'Fix for AttributeError in discovery when keystone unavailable

If a pollster is attempting to do discovery with
the keystone client and the keystone service is
not yet ready, a confusing AttributeError is
raised in the central agent logs.

This patch validates whether keystone service
has the service_catalog and tenants attribute
before the discovery plugins use keystone to
discover entities.

Change-Id: If6de6f3d9c2e898f5f7cb2501ea3adddf8b2a85d
Closes-Bug: 1493056
'}]
commit_message:
Fix for AttributeError in discovery when keystone unavailable

If a pollster is attempting to do discovery with
the keystone client and the keystone service is
not yet ready, a confusing AttributeError is
raised in the central agent logs.

This patch validates whether keystone service
has the service_catalog and tenants attribute
before the discovery plugins use keystone to
discover entities.

Change-Id: If6de6f3d9c2e898f5f7cb2501ea3adddf8b2a85d
Closes-Bug: 1493056

subject: Magnum show cmds display dictionaries with unicode u chars
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-09-22 15:51:21.000000000', 'files': ['magnumclient/tests/test_utils.py', 'magnumclient/openstack/common/cliutils.py'], 'message': "Magnum show cmds display dictionaries with unicode u chars

When a Magnum resource has an attribute that is implemented as a dictionary,
and that dictionary contains either unicode keys or unicode values, then
the Magnum client show commands display the dictionary keys/values
including a preceding 'u' character. For example, the output of the
'magnum baymodel-show <baymodel>' command includes this line:

| labels | {u'flannel_network_subnetlen': u'26',
            u'flannel_network_cidr': u'10.101.0.0/16',
            u'flannel_use_vxlan': u'true'} |

This patchset adds a recursive conversion of a dictionary's keys and
values from unicode to strings before the contents of the dictionary
are printed by the Magnum client.

Change-Id: I0fdc1f1d2dfc693652307ac66622c24f03899f8d
Closes-Bug: #1498071
"}]
commit_message:
Magnum show cmds display dictionaries with unicode u chars

When a Magnum resource has an attribute that is implemented as a dictionary,
and that dictionary contains either unicode keys or unicode values, then
the Magnum client show commands display the dictionary keys/values
including a preceding 'u' character. For example, the output of the
'magnum baymodel-show <baymodel>' command includes this line:

| labels | {u'flannel_network_subnetlen': u'26',
            u'flannel_network_cidr': u'10.101.0.0/16',
            u'flannel_use_vxlan': u'true'} |

This patchset adds a recursive conversion of a dictionary's keys and
values from unicode to strings before the contents of the dictionary
are printed by the Magnum client.

Change-Id: I0fdc1f1d2dfc693652307ac66622c24f03899f8d
Closes-Bug: #1498071

subject: Avoid needless list copy in 'scheduler_host_subset_size' case
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-22 17:35:49.000000000', 'files': ['nova/scheduler/filter_scheduler.py'], 'message': "Avoid needless list copy in 'scheduler_host_subset_size' case

When 'scheduler_host_subset_size' is set to be greater or
equal to 'len(weighed_hosts)' there is really no need to create
a temporary list of the same size and then choose a random element
from that list.

Instead just select a random element from the original list, if
the size is greater or equal, no need to make a copy.

Change-Id: I1115f21d2bc5d77d13695e4e0708a9bd6915c5ec
"}]
commit_message:
Avoid needless list copy in 'scheduler_host_subset_size' case

When 'scheduler_host_subset_size' is set to be greater or
equal to 'len(weighed_hosts)' there is really no need to create
a temporary list of the same size and then choose a random element
from that list.

Instead just select a random element from the original list, if
the size is greater or equal, no need to make a copy.

Change-Id: I1115f21d2bc5d77d13695e4e0708a9bd6915c5ec

subject: Stop encrypted disk on instance suspend/power off
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-14 14:48:16.000000000', 'files': ['specs/mitaka/approved/stop-dmcrypt-on-suspend.rst'], 'message': 'Stop encrypted disk on instance suspend/power off

Disconnecting dm-crypt device from an encrypted LVM volume while the
instance is suspended or powered off will secure user data from
unauthorized access. This will extend data at-rest protection provided
by the LVM ephemeral storage encryption feature.

Implements: blueprint stop-dmcrypt-on-suspend
SecurityImpact

Previously-approved: liberty (Ie948ccc999f79300d7449944406f063d62a95533)

Change-Id: I32cace0fb5f5ccf12638de4abd527aad5a6ec4ac
'}]
commit_message:
Stop encrypted disk on instance suspend/power off

Disconnecting dm-crypt device from an encrypted LVM volume while the
instance is suspended or powered off will secure user data from
unauthorized access. This will extend data at-rest protection provided
by the LVM ephemeral storage encryption feature.

Implements: blueprint stop-dmcrypt-on-suspend
SecurityImpact

Previously-approved: liberty (Ie948ccc999f79300d7449944406f063d62a95533)

The modified function names with parameter do not wrap on the webpage,
due to not having a normal breakpoint (usually spaces).  Including a
space after the opening paren, as well as one before the closing paren

commit_message:
Add spaces around function params for browser to linewrap on

The modified function names with parameter do not wrap on the webpage,
due to not having a normal breakpoint (usually spaces).  Including a
space after the opening paren, as well as one before the closing paren
to visually balance, seems to be the best option I can see for fixing
this while still maintaining readability and coherence in the rst file
itself.

Closes-Bug: #1373110
Change-Id: Iea09ca21ff50a51bb28f518b0b124f129cf06ae2

commit_message:
Selects IPv4 preferentially for internal_ip

Hadoop doesn't support IPv6.
Selects IPv4 preferentially for internal_ip/management_ip
when private network has IPv4/IPv6 dual subnets.

Change-Id: Ibc808d5467ea6db081cdc98655c7eb7faffa6ec3
Closes-Bug: #1489433

subject: Bring bandit config up-to-date
revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2015-09-22 13:09:12.000000000', 'files': ['bandit.yaml'], 'message': 'Bring bandit config up-to-date

Bandit 0.13.2 was released and this is the min version in
requirements.txt. This version updated the tests that are
available.

Using the latest default bandit.yaml from bandit 0.13.2:

1) Copied the latest bandit config stuff from the top of the file.
2) Copied the list of all tests from the sample "All" profile:

   - Left the new tests that we weren't running disabled, these will
     be enabled if they work, marked with TODO.
   - Removed crypto_random and shell_injection since these are not
     in the list of all tests anymore.
   - Some tests weren't enabled before, I added the reason why.

3) After the profiles comes the configuration for each test, which
   bandit 0.13.2 has changed. Changes to the configs for the
   blacklist_calls and blacklist_imports tests caused some new lines
   to be flagged, so these will be handled separately.

Follow-on commits will handle enabling the new tests or providing a
reason why the test is not run and updating the test configs to the
latest from 0.13.2.

[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/bandit/tree/bandit/config/bandit.yaml?id=0.13.2

Change-Id: Iee28a669853497d3fa79d6d89ecbb2d8b755e78e
'}]
commit_message:
Bring bandit config up-to-date

Bandit 0.13.2 was released and this is the min version in
requirements.txt. This version updated the tests that are
available.

Using the latest default bandit.yaml from bandit 0.13.2:

1) Copied the latest bandit config stuff from the top of the file.
2) Copied the list of all tests from the sample "All" profile:

   - Left the new tests that we weren't running disabled, these will
     be enabled if they work, marked with TODO.
   - Removed crypto_random and shell_injection since these are not
     in the list of all tests anymore.
   - Some tests weren't enabled before, I added the reason why.

3) After the profiles comes the configuration for each test, which
   bandit 0.13.2 has changed. Changes to the configs for the
   blacklist_calls and blacklist_imports tests caused some new lines
   to be flagged, so these will be handled separately.

Follow-on commits will handle enabling the new tests or providing a
reason why the test is not run and updating the test configs to the
latest from 0.13.2.

[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/bandit/tree/bandit/config/bandit.yaml?id=0.13.2

Change-Id: Iee28a669853497d3fa79d6d89ecbb2d8b755e78e

commit_message:
Clean up bandit profiles

The profile that we run for the gate run is renamed to "gate"
from "keystone_conservative".
This will be the standard configuration for OpenStack projects.

Removed the keystone_verbose profile since this isn't used.

Change-Id: I828afc5402ab15c615bfd7955a578d055ce4aa8a

commit_message:
Blueprint for Websockify security proxy framework

This blueprint proposes a generic framework for supporting
man-in-the-middle authentication and encryption between
Websockify and the hypervisor graphics servers.  It also
proposes a reference driver for that framework for TLS
security.

Spec for blueprint websocket-proxy-to-host-security

Change-Id: Iffaa57bfff24af4b0b133dc159eaaaa5ddd013e3
Previously-approved: juno, kilo

commit_message:
Disable translation copy

By default Zanata copies translations from other versions, let's disable
this for now, it currently leads to undesired effects.

See also
http://docs.zanata.org/en/latest/user-guide/translation-reuse/copy-trans/

Change-Id: I4ed5ad34c1c42ac70926a379b58e2dd72cb6a750

subject: Removing argument printing
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-09-22 11:17:40.000000000', 'files': ['bandit/plugins/secret_config_option.py', 'bandit/plugins/insecure_ssl_tls.py', 'bandit/plugins/blacklist_calls.py', 'tests/unit/core/test_util.py', 'tests/unit/core/test_context.py', 'bandit/plugins/exec_as_root.py', 'bandit/plugins/injection_shell.py', 'bandit/plugins/crypto_request_no_cert_validation.py', 'bandit/core/utils.py', 'bandit/core/context.py'], 'message': 'Removing argument printing

Explicitly printing out the arguments to calls that have triggered a
warning is superfluous as the entire code string is printed out in
the message anyway. It is also error prone and fragile as the AST
nodes could be nearly anything, making it hard to decode properly.

This patch removes the explicit functionality.

Change-Id: I8e703cefc7c702e6fb876c3928f84a3f9c4410d9
Fixes-bug: 1497688
'}]
commit_message:
Removing argument printing

Explicitly printing out the arguments to calls that have triggered a
warning is superfluous as the entire code string is printed out in
the message anyway. It is also error prone and fragile as the AST
nodes could be nearly anything, making it hard to decode properly.

This patch removes the explicit functionality.

Change-Id: I8e703cefc7c702e6fb876c3928f84a3f9c4410d9
Fixes-bug: 1497688

commit_message:
Fix for keystone LDAP pkg missing

This change adds the python-ldap package to keystone by default and
improves the conditional by which the ldap domain specific config
drivers are loaded.

Change-Id: Idf85bb109654cbb46755928504d6a19c090a7514
Closes-bug: 1497669

commit_message:
Disable Tuskar UI

We should not enable Tuskar UI by default. It's been broken due to
packaging issues for quite a while. While that appears to possibly be
fixed now by moving to a newer Delorean repo, we don't know for sure.
Best to disable it by default and let people opt-in, vs. forcing them to
opt-out.

Change-Id: I063c9f3db100a311fad8a518a1fb833527911ee7

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-03 03:54:42.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': 'Handle nova-compute failure during a soft reboot

A soft reboot is soft in the sense that we let the instance
respond to ACPI events before shutdown. We still shutdown the
libvirt domain however.

Therefore, if nova-compute crashes having shutdown the instance
domain, but before starting it again, when nova-compute
restarts it will see an instance in a task_state indicating a
soft reboot, but with the power_state being shutdown. This was
unexpected and caused an instance.save() to crash out.

In those cases, change the task_state to one corresponding to
a hard reboot, and continue on.

Change-Id: Icdde0bc2e8c8c90ba20f48f010f230ae4d4dca54
Closes-Bug: #1072751
'}]
commit_message:
Handle nova-compute failure during a soft reboot

A soft reboot is soft in the sense that we let the instance
respond to ACPI events before shutdown. We still shutdown the
libvirt domain however.

Therefore, if nova-compute crashes having shutdown the instance
domain, but before starting it again, when nova-compute
restarts it will see an instance in a task_state indicating a
soft reboot, but with the power_state being shutdown. This was
unexpected and caused an instance.save() to crash out.

In those cases, change the task_state to one corresponding to
a hard reboot, and continue on.

Change-Id: Icdde0bc2e8c8c90ba20f48f010f230ae4d4dca54
Closes-Bug: #1072751

subject: Add pre_create_files resource and helper class
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-08-05 01:33:19.000000000', 'files': ['lib/puppet/type/pre_create_files.rb', 'manifests/pre_create_files.pp', 'lib/puppet/provider/pre_create_files/touch.rb'], 'message': 'Add pre_create_files resource and helper class

This patch adds a new custom type resource called pre_create_files
which inspects the Puppet catalog at creation time to pre-create
directories, files, and executables. This can be used alongside
tripleo::noop to facilitate config file generation without
actually installing packages.

The motivation is to use this resource/class in a docker "agent"
container to help generate config files for various services
without actually installing packages or starting services
(because those things happen in separate docker containers)

Tested w/ puppet 4.x against the TripleO compute and controller roles.

Change-Id: If12e568c8deef9415703c5a9d546aef75b0caa5c
'}]
commit_message:
Add pre_create_files resource and helper class

This patch adds a new custom type resource called pre_create_files
which inspects the Puppet catalog at creation time to pre-create
directories, files, and executables. This can be used alongside
tripleo::noop to facilitate config file generation without
actually installing packages.

The motivation is to use this resource/class in a docker "agent"
container to help generate config files for various services
without actually installing packages or starting services
(because those things happen in separate docker containers)

Tested w/ puppet 4.x against the TripleO compute and controller roles.

Change-Id: If12e568c8deef9415703c5a9d546aef75b0caa5c

There is code in ZanataUtils that will read an existing zanata.xml,
and parse the details into an instance to support changing an
existing XML file. We have never made use of this functionality,

Change-Id: Ie3e3ba3d8171ae912f2706dfeb756c007b51b703

commit_message:
No longer read an existing zanata.xml

There is code in ZanataUtils that will read an existing zanata.xml,
and parse the details into an instance to support changing an
existing XML file. We have never made use of this functionality,
and it just tripped me up when testing a change for the last time,
destroy it.

Change-Id: Ie3e3ba3d8171ae912f2706dfeb756c007b51b703

subject: Fix a little error with the None auth type
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-09-22 16:33:08.000000000', 'files': ['os_client_config/config.py'], 'message': 'Fix a little error with the None auth type

Ironic has a mode where it does not use auth, but we still funnel that
through the ksa admin_token type for consistency of code. The hack we
had to do that went too far and caused validate_auth to strip the fake
token we were adding.

Change-Id: Id5275ac7db1a6052db02c2286cbf88862cb1ff70
'}]
commit_message:
Fix a little error with the None auth type

Ironic has a mode where it does not use auth, but we still funnel that
through the ksa admin_token type for consistency of code. The hack we
had to do that went too far and caused validate_auth to strip the fake
token we were adding.

Change-Id: Id5275ac7db1a6052db02c2286cbf88862cb1ff70

commit_message:
Fix docstring & args when fetching the Zanata XML

When the code was refactored into ZanataRestService, one part
was missed -- namely, _fetch_zanata_xml() in ZanataUtils still
supported a verify argument, but never used it. Remove it.

Change-Id: Id6d39f24bacbf784b2cd230268cdc67ab3fe75fa

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-26 00:10:43.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': 'Dont eager load volume type specs on volume list

Some drivers need extra specs loaded on create and the session could be
closed by the time they access them. However for a volume list, eager
loading these attributes causes a severe performance penalty.

Move the eager load to the single volume get case.

Change-Id: I6fbf5508684a01a7df7930d4f1b4a47adeefe521
Closes-Bug: 1486289
'}]
commit_message:
Dont eager load volume type specs on volume list

Some drivers need extra specs loaded on create and the session could be
closed by the time they access them. However for a volume list, eager
loading these attributes causes a severe performance penalty.

Move the eager load to the single volume get case.

Change-Id: I6fbf5508684a01a7df7930d4f1b4a47adeefe521
Closes-Bug: 1486289

commit_message:
Merge upstream_translation scripts

Merge upstream_translation_update_manuals.sh,
upstream_translation_horizon.sh, and
upstream_translation_django_openstack_auth.sh into
upstream_translation_update.sh.

Adjust job definition for these projects so that the new scripts
get used.

Adjust layout.yaml for change, remove now obsolete condition.

Change-Id: I54d560398daa67af8effeb794fce11e53affa1a6

subject: Revert "[OpsGuide]Make RabbitMQ OCF script tolerate timeouts"
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-09-17 10:21:50.000000000', 'files': ['pages/operations/troubleshoot/9140-amqp.rst'], 'message': 'Revert "[OpsGuide]Make RabbitMQ OCF script tolerate timeouts"

This reverts commit ad7999d3f8288d56c2167fc99c5371acb030fdb3.

Unfortunately due to bug 
https://bugs.launchpad.net/fuel/+bug/1496386 the 
provided command ('crm_resource --resource ...')
leads to RabbitMQ failure which can not be
healed by OCF script. 

So we need to remove that advice from the docs
until the referenced bug is fixed.

Change-Id: I25ccb3b3afdff44f90dfa29ba00fa8a60d5c3e2a'}]
commit_message:
Revert "[OpsGuide]Make RabbitMQ OCF script tolerate timeouts"

This reverts commit ad7999d3f8288d56c2167fc99c5371acb030fdb3.

Unfortunately due to bug 
https://bugs.launchpad.net/fuel/+bug/1496386 the 
provided command ('crm_resource --resource ...')
leads to RabbitMQ failure which can not be
healed by OCF script. 

So we need to remove that advice from the docs
until the referenced bug is fixed.

Change-Id: I25ccb3b3afdff44f90dfa29ba00fa8a60d5c3e2a

* Slight wording improvements.
* Add "." at end of all strings.

Change-Id: I252c023438c4fe82873a1616b36391f2a2048853

subject: Allow long unbreakable strings
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-13 16:06:13.000000000', 'files': ['tests/test_titles.py'], 'message': 'Allow long unbreakable strings

We already allow HTTP URLs to ignore the linebreak limit. There are
other reasons to need tokens longer than 80 characters, such as internal
reference names. Allow any length of token so long as it is the only
token on the line.

Change-Id: Iee3e90a5d22d1c4b1180a3f3028b2d4c29cd3377
'}]
commit_message:
Allow long unbreakable strings

We already allow HTTP URLs to ignore the linebreak limit. There are
other reasons to need tokens longer than 80 characters, such as internal
reference names. Allow any length of token so long as it is the only
token on the line.

Change-Id: Iee3e90a5d22d1c4b1180a3f3028b2d4c29cd3377

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-08-11 10:55:36.000000000', 'files': ['pages/release-notes/v6-0/0063-update-the-product.rst'], 'message': "Small fix to yum manual update command

As it was found during testing our official repository isn't signed with
a signature. So 'yum' must be issued with '--nogpgcheck' in order to

Change-Id: Ia5c23a498eb7b968d615238fbaa9736d1d2f3344

commit_message:
Small fix to yum manual update command

As it was found during testing our official repository isn't signed with
a signature. So 'yum' must be issued with '--nogpgcheck' in order to
update a node correctly.

Change-Id: Ia5c23a498eb7b968d615238fbaa9736d1d2f3344

This is failing because nothing does the install-from-git bit for

commit_message:
Remove lib-forward-testing from python-barbicanclient

This is failing because nothing does the install-from-git bit for
python-barbicanclient.  cinder is the only project that imports it at
the moment, but unless the barbican server is configured its not doing
anything anyway.

Change-Id: Iad4dee2a59561c78c660dd03ea359a15d7788a65

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-09-22 11:29:28.000000000', 'files': ['files/fuel-ha-utils/ocf/rabbitmq'], 'message': 'Start RabbitMQ app on notify

On notify, if we detect that we are a part of a cluster we still

Change-Id: I307452b687a6100cc4489c8decebbc3dccdbc432
'}]
commit_message:
Start RabbitMQ app on notify

On notify, if we detect that we are a part of a cluster we still
need to start the RabbitMQ application, because it is always
down after action_start finishes.

Closes-Bug: #1496386
Change-Id: I307452b687a6100cc4489c8decebbc3dccdbc432

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1941, 'name': 'Lin Hua Cheng', 'email': 'os.lcheng@gmail.com', 'username': 'lin-hua-cheng'}, {'_account_id': 5623, 'name': 'David Lyle', 'email': 'dklyle0@gmail.com', 'username': 'david-lyle'}, {'_account_id': 6162, 'name': 'Dan Nguyen', 'email': 'dan.nguyens.mail@gmail.com', 'username': 'daniel-a-nguyen'}, {'_account_id': 7179, 'name': 'Brad Pokorny', 'email': 'brad_pokorny@symantec.com', 'username': 'bpokorny'}, {'_account_id': 9981, 'name': 'Doug Fish', 'email': 'drfish@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'doug-fish'}, {'_account_id': 11098, 'name': 'Brian Tully', 'email': 'brian.tully@hpe.com', 'username': 'btully'}, {'_account_id': 11778, 'name': 'Diana Whitten', 'email': 'hurgleburgler@gmail.com', 'username': 'hurgleburgler'}, {'_account_id': 11798, 'name': 'Michael Hagedorn', 'email': 'mike.hagedorn@hpe.com', 'username': 'mwhagedorn'}, {'_account_id': 13785, 'name': 'Kelly Domico', 'email': 'kelly.domico@hp.com', 'username': 'kdomico'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 18, 'created': '2015-07-22 19:57:52.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/identity/projects/tests.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/identity/projects/tables.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/identity/users/panel.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/identity/projects/workflows.py', 'openstack_dashboard/api/keystone.py'], 'message': 'Multidomain false and project admin support

To test manually you need to

1. pull this patch
2. set your local_settings.py to
   a) OPENSTACK_API_VERSIONS = {"identity": 3,}
   b) OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_MULTIDOMAIN_SUPPORT = False
   c) OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_URL = "http://%s:5000/v3" \
      % OPENSTACK_HOST
   d) set your keystone policy file to
      ...
         'identity': 'keystone_policy.json',
      ...
   e) set your devstack keystone policy file to the same file
      i.e. /etc/keystone/conf/policy.json

3. goto login screen log in as Admin (cloud admin/project admin)
4. observe the login screen doesn't require a domain field
5. All new resources will be created in the default domain
6. No domain scoped token is required

Co-Authored-By: Brian Tully <brian.tully@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Dan Nguyen <dan.nguyens.mail@gmail.com>

Closes-Bug: #1472612
Change-Id: Ic1c4eb59e2a5704beb341e53c581d820a4e99f2b
'}]
commit_message:
Multidomain false and project admin support

To test manually you need to

1. pull this patch
2. set your local_settings.py to
   a) OPENSTACK_API_VERSIONS = {"identity": 3,}
   b) OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_MULTIDOMAIN_SUPPORT = False
   c) OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_URL = "http://%s:5000/v3" \
      % OPENSTACK_HOST
   d) set your keystone policy file to
      ...
         'identity': 'keystone_policy.json',
      ...
   e) set your devstack keystone policy file to the same file
      i.e. /etc/keystone/conf/policy.json

3. goto login screen log in as Admin (cloud admin/project admin)
4. observe the login screen doesn't require a domain field
5. All new resources will be created in the default domain
6. No domain scoped token is required

Co-Authored-By: Brian Tully <brian.tully@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Dan Nguyen <dan.nguyens.mail@gmail.com>

Closes-Bug: #1472612
Change-Id: Ic1c4eb59e2a5704beb341e53c581d820a4e99f2b

commit_message:
Add epoch :1 on packaging

Due legacy 'fpm' package creation, we have to set the epoch of the
package as '1' for updates.

Fixes: https://midonet.atlassian.net/browse/MNA-812
Change-Id: I37c5c058e55f62f00e982c33692d57f28270bd0f

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-09-15 17:23:32.000000000', 'files': ['lib/puppet/parser/functions/is_service_default.rb', 'spec/functions/is_service_default_spec.rb'], 'message': "Create is_service_default function

This change creates a parser function that can be used to check if a
value is set to the '<SERVICE DEFAULT>' string. The is_service_default
function will return true if the parameter passed in is '<SERVICE
DEFAULT>' otherwise it returns false.

Checks like:
  if ($our_param == '<SERVICE DEFAULT>') { ... }

Should be replaced with:
  if is_service_default($our_param) { ... }

This change will also be useful if we ever refactor the default value
string or have different values as this function could be updated to
support multiple values without having to adjust the calling code.

Change-Id: I07b8b9b54ed1e88891f74da9b930e4f39876a607
"}]
commit_message:
Create is_service_default function

This change creates a parser function that can be used to check if a
value is set to the '<SERVICE DEFAULT>' string. The is_service_default
function will return true if the parameter passed in is '<SERVICE
DEFAULT>' otherwise it returns false.

Checks like:
  if ($our_param == '<SERVICE DEFAULT>') { ... }

Should be replaced with:
  if is_service_default($our_param) { ... }

This change will also be useful if we ever refactor the default value
string or have different values as this function could be updated to
support multiple values without having to adjust the calling code.

Change-Id: I07b8b9b54ed1e88891f74da9b930e4f39876a607

subject: Fix race condition in V1 Records API
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-09-22 13:16:57.000000000', 'files': ['designate/tests/test_api/test_v1/test_records.py', 'designate/api/v1/records.py'], 'message': 'Fix race condition in V1 Records API

When listing records in the V1 API, two calls to central
are made - once for records once for recordsets - if the
content of either changes between the two calls, a failure
can occour. Instead, we already have all the data we need
so use it from the recordsets rather than make two calls

Change-Id: Ic43d7e8c0d60267ec4788b63ed5f7e88e7bbe625
Closes-Bug: 1487934
'}]
commit_message:
Fix race condition in V1 Records API

When listing records in the V1 API, two calls to central
are made - once for records once for recordsets - if the
content of either changes between the two calls, a failure
can occour. Instead, we already have all the data we need
so use it from the recordsets rather than make two calls

Change-Id: Ic43d7e8c0d60267ec4788b63ed5f7e88e7bbe625
Closes-Bug: 1487934

subject: Correct a possible DNSService connection leak
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-09-22 11:24:45.000000000', 'files': ['designate/service.py'], 'message': 'Correct a possible DNSService connection leak

There was a potential codepath where, if after parsing
a packet, an exception was raused, we may leave TCP sockets
around without explicitly closing them

Change-Id: I6d619d05c7d0250cb5ae55212129e0d849c66c9d
'}]
commit_message:
Correct a possible DNSService connection leak

There was a potential codepath where, if after parsing
a packet, an exception was raused, we may leave TCP sockets
around without explicitly closing them

Change-Id: I6d619d05c7d0250cb5ae55212129e0d849c66c9d

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-09-14 11:11:57.000000000', 'files': ['tools/gate/build-images'], 'message': 'gate: custom handling of cloudera images

Generating cloudera images requires lots of space, in terms of cached
resources (distribution base images, packages, etc) and generated
images. This causes the generation of all the cloudera images to
(almost?) always fail on the gate slaves, as running out of space.

As a workaround to this, manually invoke the generation of cloudera
images per-distro, cleaning the cache (which contains mostly stuff
specific to the last built distribution) and the generated images after
each run.

Change-Id: I4468f9e2926e101864e73f8aedf7b0612a3f7a96
'}]
commit_message:
gate: custom handling of cloudera images

Generating cloudera images requires lots of space, in terms of cached
resources (distribution base images, packages, etc) and generated
images. This causes the generation of all the cloudera images to
(almost?) always fail on the gate slaves, as running out of space.

As a workaround to this, manually invoke the generation of cloudera
images per-distro, cleaning the cache (which contains mostly stuff
specific to the last built distribution) and the generated images after
each run.

Change-Id: I4468f9e2926e101864e73f8aedf7b0612a3f7a96

commit_message:
Compute v2.1 docs clean up (part15) (os-block-device-mapping)

  WADL file and JSON files are from v2 ext.
    Removes listServers
       (since it does not exist on
       nova/nova/api/openstack/compute/block_device_mapping.py)
    Adds block-device-mapping-v1
    URL path is changed from /v2 to /v2.1
    Keep JSON sample files only (XML sample files are not included)

P.S.
  All attributes of block-device mapping is in
    https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/stable/kilo/nova/block_device.py
  (Both version)

Change-Id: I5aa201102aabd4b7581002f6eccca0b67e070fcb

For example:

These two commands have the same informations print in the CLI at present.
* murano --debug environment-list
This command should include request and response informations in the CLI.
As bellow:
curl -i -X POST -H 'X-Auth-Token: 2d3cafec806d44fbbf44dd9f19778a1e' -H
......

Change-Id: I3da0c33adfebcbae00ccdfa9f5eaca9a2d3cb662
Closes-Bug: #1497890
"}]
commit_message:
Output detail informations about murano --debug command

For example:
* murano environment-list
* murano --debug environment-list
These two commands have the same informations print in the CLI at present.
* murano --debug environment-list
This command should include request and response informations in the CLI.
As bellow:
curl -i -X POST -H 'X-Auth-Token: 2d3cafec806d44fbbf44dd9f19778a1e' -H
......

Change-Id: I3da0c33adfebcbae00ccdfa9f5eaca9a2d3cb662
Closes-Bug: #1497890

leading/trailing in the name field.

breaking the user, although leading/trailing is unclear usecase. This
patch allows leading/trailing spaces but will strip them, and still
disallows that all characters are spaces in the name fields for
flavor_mange, servers, aggregates(and availability_zones),
create_backup, create_image, rebuild.

Due to the server_groups and security_groups(no jsons-schema in v2.1)
have consistent behavior between v2 and v2.1. So this patch won't
change server_groups.

But when creating servers, the name of security_groups, availability_zone
and keyapir isn't stripped the leading/trailing spaces. This is for
backward compatible with users who already use legacy V2 API created
security_group, availabilit_zone and keypair with leading/trailing
in the name, otherwise the users can't use those resource anymore.

Change-Id: Ic8d8416c77b5cd810e3c5e79b6d2df409ac72bea

commit_message:
Filter leading/trailing spaces for name field in v2.1 compat mode

In the V2 API, there are three cases for the name field:

1. disallow any space in the name: server_groups.

2. allow leading/trailing whitespaces, strip spaces and disallow
all characters are spaces: flavor_manage, servers.

3. allow leading/trailing whitespacess, no strip spaces and allow
all characters are spaces: aggregates, cells, create_backup,
security_groups, create_image, rebuild

But currently in the V2.1 API and V2.1 API compat mode disallows
leading/trailing in the name field.

For the V2.1 compat mode, we should relax the validation to avoid
breaking the user, although leading/trailing is unclear usecase. This
patch allows leading/trailing spaces but will strip them, and still
disallows that all characters are spaces in the name fields for
flavor_mange, servers, aggregates(and availability_zones),
create_backup, create_image, rebuild.

Due to the server_groups and security_groups(no jsons-schema in v2.1)
have consistent behavior between v2 and v2.1. So this patch won't
change server_groups.

But when creating servers, the name of security_groups, availability_zone
and keyapir isn't stripped the leading/trailing spaces. This is for
backward compatible with users who already use legacy V2 API created
security_group, availabilit_zone and keypair with leading/trailing
in the name, otherwise the users can't use those resource anymore.

Change-Id: Ic8d8416c77b5cd810e3c5e79b6d2df409ac72bea
Partial-Bug: #1498075

subject: Prevent image status being directly modified via v1
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-22 14:42:57.000000000', 'files': ['glance/api/v1/__init__.py', 'glance/api/v1/images.py', 'glance/tests/functional/v1/test_api.py', 'glance/tests/integration/legacy_functional/test_v1_api.py'], 'message': "Prevent image status being directly modified via v1

Users shouldn't be able to change an image's status directly via the v1 API.

Some existing consumers of Glance set the x-image-meta-status header in
requests to the Glance API, eg:

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/plugins/xenserver/xenapi/etc/xapi.d/plugins/glance#L184

We should try to prevent users setting 'status' via v1, but without breaking
existing benign API calls such as these.

I've adopted the following approach (which has some prior art in 'protected properties').

If a PUT request is received which contains an x-image-meta-status header:

* The user provided status is ignored if it matches the current image
  status (this prevents benign calls such as the nova one above from
  breaking). The usual code (eg 200) will be returned.

* If the user provided status doesn't match the current image status (ie
  there is a real attempt to change the value) 403 will be returned. This
  will break any calls which currently intentionally change the status.

APIImpact

Change-Id: Ieb1bf63494246c42258c8802473254703494e3d1
Closes-bug: 1482371
"}]
commit_message:
Prevent image status being directly modified via v1

Users shouldn't be able to change an image's status directly via the v1 API.

Some existing consumers of Glance set the x-image-meta-status header in
requests to the Glance API, eg:

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/plugins/xenserver/xenapi/etc/xapi.d/plugins/glance#L184

We should try to prevent users setting 'status' via v1, but without breaking
existing benign API calls such as these.

I've adopted the following approach (which has some prior art in 'protected properties').

If a PUT request is received which contains an x-image-meta-status header:

* The user provided status is ignored if it matches the current image
  status (this prevents benign calls such as the nova one above from
  breaking). The usual code (eg 200) will be returned.

* If the user provided status doesn't match the current image status (ie
  there is a real attempt to change the value) 403 will be returned. This
  will break any calls which currently intentionally change the status.

APIImpact

Change-Id: Ieb1bf63494246c42258c8802473254703494e3d1
Closes-bug: 1482371

commit_message:
Fixed the output of list artifacts API calls

The output of list artifacts calls (GET /v3/artifacts/sometype and
GET /v3/artifacts/sometype/drafts) contained just a json-array of
artifacts, instead of a proper dict, containing "artifacts", "next" and
"first" section.
This patch fixes it.

At the same time it fixes a minor bug in artifacts' SQL Alchemy API
which prevented pagination queries from working properly when the marker
was passed.

APIImpact
Closes-Bug: #1486118
FastTrack

Co-Authored-By: Alexander Tivelkov <ativelkov@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Kairat Kushaev <kkushaev@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: I46cce6654c2120aafe92bb885ab0c3453fe485f8

commit_message:
Fixed deps in setup.py and a bug in tests

Currently the deps of oslo.i18n wasn't aligned with
Kilo global-requirements.

Now tests are not execute by runtests.py but tox
call directly py.test, as there was a bug in the exec
of runtests.py. This is a temporary solution as
testr will be used soon as testing framework

Close bug: 1498078

Change-Id: I07daddb14ab75fe089c98c8e00c24ecb550ada82

commit_message:
federation.idp use correct subprocess

keystone.common.environment sets up the correct subprocess
implementation based on the environment that keystone is
started in and this subprocess should be used instead of
importing subprocess directly. This wasn't being done in
keystone.contrib.federation.idp.

Change-Id: Ib7b625b0d6bb5feccd251a0abfcdea59baee3ee4

commit_message:
add delta transfomer support

this patch adds support for a delta transformer. the transformer's
only functionality is to calculate the delta between current sample
and previous sample.

conditions:
- it will disregard any out of order samples
- a growth_only param is available to capture only positive deltas
- supports renaming to a new meter name using same schema as other
  transformers.

using this transformer, we also create a cpu.delta meter which will
enable another view of cpu meter. this delta meter will allow for
(relatively) accurate cputime calculations and will cope with cputime
resets.

DocImpact

Change-Id: Iabcad20d500e3157e4d19f8b2ebffd770218165b
Closes-Bug: #1417949

commit_message:
[Contributor Guide] Content Docs builds to RST

This patch:
1. Converts the page https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Documentation/Builds
   to RST.
2. Fixes small grammar mistakes.
3. Fixes the outdated content ("changing Icehouse/Havana to Juno/Kilo,
   updating the note about status of user guides conversion to RST, etc).
4. Changes the Maven plug-in version from 1.8.0 for Grizzly to 2.1.4
   for Kilo.
5. Changes https://github.com/openstack... links with
   http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack ones throughout the doc.

Driver's detach volume is not called while handling
failure during Cinder attach. This can result in data
loss in the case of VMware driver since the instance
VM is not re-configured to remove volume's vmdk. Also,
the connection won't be terminated if attach fails.
This patch fixes the above issues with cleanup during

Change-Id: I62c0800f68d8fd89fed98eea9e3f95d1adbe9d7f
"}]
commit_message:
Detach and terminate conn if Cinder attach fails

Driver's detach volume is not called while handling
failure during Cinder attach. This can result in data
loss in the case of VMware driver since the instance
VM is not re-configured to remove volume's vmdk. Also,
the connection won't be terminated if attach fails.
This patch fixes the above issues with cleanup during
Cinder attach failure.

Closes-bug: #1460044
Change-Id: I62c0800f68d8fd89fed98eea9e3f95d1adbe9d7f

revisions:
[{'number': 32, 'created': '2015-08-13 09:56:00.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/functional/test_server.py', 'neutron/wsgi.py', 'neutron/service.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/test_wsgi.py', 'neutron/server/__init__.py'], 'message': 'Handle SIGHUP: neutron-server (single process mode)

Neutron server does not use ServiceLauncher from
openstack.common.service.code to start its services, even
though ServiceLauncher supports restarting a service on
receiving SIGHUP.

Neutron server should move to using ServiceLauncher so that it
can handle SIGHUP when both when running in single process mode
and in multi-worker mode.

Moreover, neither ServiceLauncher nor ProcessLauncher are supposed
to be instantiated twice in one process. It is much more safe to use
one launcher instance to launch different services.

This change makes neutron server to use ServiceLauncher to run services
in single process mode and introduces refactoring of neutron server, so
that it uses only one instance of ServiceLauncher and one instance of
ProcessLauncher to start api and rpc services.

Modified the functional test to use mmap instead of temporary file for
writing messages in case reset was called.

Modified a check for activity of rpc service running in a single process
mode in the functional test so that it is possible to determine whether
it has really started.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1276694
Partial-Bug: #1438321
Change-Id: Ic0850331844d5f7e09e9089d6a33d8ed39235a4a
'}]
commit_message:
Handle SIGHUP: neutron-server (single process mode)

Neutron server does not use ServiceLauncher from
openstack.common.service.code to start its services, even
though ServiceLauncher supports restarting a service on
receiving SIGHUP.

Neutron server should move to using ServiceLauncher so that it
can handle SIGHUP when both when running in single process mode
and in multi-worker mode.

Moreover, neither ServiceLauncher nor ProcessLauncher are supposed
to be instantiated twice in one process. It is much more safe to use
one launcher instance to launch different services.

This change makes neutron server to use ServiceLauncher to run services
in single process mode and introduces refactoring of neutron server, so
that it uses only one instance of ServiceLauncher and one instance of
ProcessLauncher to start api and rpc services.

Modified the functional test to use mmap instead of temporary file for
writing messages in case reset was called.

Modified a check for activity of rpc service running in a single process
mode in the functional test so that it is possible to determine whether
it has really started.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1276694
Partial-Bug: #1438321
Change-Id: Ic0850331844d5f7e09e9089d6a33d8ed39235a4a

commit_message:
Add validation for Cisco CSR firewall (direction and port) association

Cisco CSR allows up to two firewalls applied on the same port with
different directions.

Add validation in CSR FWaaS plugin when processing a request for creating
or updating a firewall on a port with a direction:

(1) Get firewall association information from the database table based
on the port in the request.
(2) The request will be rejected if a firewall has been already applied
on that port with the same direction in the request.

Change-Id: Iac717aa6b6c763dc419802df615ca757214461ac
Close-Bug: 1468471

commit_message:
[WIP] Refactored configuration option to look more like OVS

- created get_config_map class
- separated common agent config and lb specific agent config
- This fix is not yet using positional arguemtns for the configs but a
  dictionary instead. If desired, this is TBD!

Change-Id: I167f7f12989b24a1de79e78deceb01b1a3cd5723
Related-Bug: #1468803

when a security group members or rules change, if it just
notify the l2 agents with 'security_groups_member_updated'
or 'security_groups_rule_updated', the all related l2 agents
need to get the security group details through RPC from
neutron-server, when the number of l2 agents is large, the
load of neutron-server is heavy.
this patch use fanout RPC message with the changed sg details
to notify the l2 agents, then l2 agents which has the related
devices update the sg information in their memory, they do not
need to get the sg details through RPC.

Closes-bug: #1463375
Change-Id: I3eca91afe58389c447fa9c1c59e15f0e21e89111
"}]
commit_message:
Use fanout RPC message to nofity the security group's change

when a security group members or rules change, if it just
notify the l2 agents with 'security_groups_member_updated'
or 'security_groups_rule_updated', the all related l2 agents
need to get the security group details through RPC from
neutron-server, when the number of l2 agents is large, the
load of neutron-server is heavy.
this patch use fanout RPC message with the changed sg details
to notify the l2 agents, then l2 agents which has the related
devices update the sg information in their memory, they do not
need to get the sg details through RPC.

Closes-bug: #1463375
Change-Id: I3eca91afe58389c447fa9c1c59e15f0e21e89111

commit_message:
Add RPC test for DVR

Apart from adding the RPC tests, I made the return value
of get_dvr_mac_address_by_host consistent, regardless if
a port for that host already exists or not. Previously it
was returning either a DB object or a dict depending on
if the port already exists or not.

Change-Id: Ic86a7e80d179be571bdea4144707ccb7a96e61c5
