[{'number': 12, 'created': '2015-07-09 14:58:40.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/common/ipv6_utils.py', 'etc/neutron.conf', 'neutron/tests/unit/common/test_ipv6_utils.py'], 'message': "Added config variable to enable IPv6

Description:
Presently Neutron detects if IPv6 is enabled by reading
/proc/sys/net/ipv6/conf/default/disable_ipv6, this is not reliable since
this controls the default policy for binding IPv6 to newly created
interfaces rather than the capability to filter IPv6 traffic which
traverses Ethernet bridges.

The operator may want to specify a default policy preventing IPv6 from
binding to new interfaces, then explicitly enable IPv6 on select
interfaces. The default policy of binding IPv6 link-local addresses to
all newly created interfaces can expose the host from tenant networks
via these link-local addresses. By enabling this option, IPv6 behaves
like IPv4 and only binds to interfaces on which it is explicitly
configured.

Since this setting is independent in each network namespace, a Neutron
router or DHCP agent can still function normally with this option
enabled in the default namespace. In most configurations the default
namespace is only responsible for bridging traffic between external
networks, service namespaces and instance TAP interfaces. All this is
possible including filtering IPv6 traffic with this policy set.

Implementation:
Add new config variable 'ipv6_enabled' to neutron.conf to configure
IPv6. By default the existing detection logic is used.

DocImpact

Change-Id: Ie8240884655eb002359389bdb195796970622fdc
Closes-Bug: 1459856
"}]
commit_message:
Added config variable to enable IPv6

Description:
Presently Neutron detects if IPv6 is enabled by reading
/proc/sys/net/ipv6/conf/default/disable_ipv6, this is not reliable since
this controls the default policy for binding IPv6 to newly created
interfaces rather than the capability to filter IPv6 traffic which
traverses Ethernet bridges.

The operator may want to specify a default policy preventing IPv6 from
binding to new interfaces, then explicitly enable IPv6 on select
interfaces. The default policy of binding IPv6 link-local addresses to
all newly created interfaces can expose the host from tenant networks
via these link-local addresses. By enabling this option, IPv6 behaves
like IPv4 and only binds to interfaces on which it is explicitly
configured.

Since this setting is independent in each network namespace, a Neutron
router or DHCP agent can still function normally with this option
enabled in the default namespace. In most configurations the default
namespace is only responsible for bridging traffic between external
networks, service namespaces and instance TAP interfaces. All this is
possible including filtering IPv6 traffic with this policy set.

Implementation:
Add new config variable 'ipv6_enabled' to neutron.conf to configure
IPv6. By default the existing detection logic is used.

DocImpact

Change-Id: Ie8240884655eb002359389bdb195796970622fdc
Closes-Bug: 1459856

commit_message:
Fix router namespaces delete by interface removal.

When deleting an interface from a router that already has another interface
attached to it, all router namespaces are getting deleted.
The interfaces should have non-dhcp-enabled subnets associate with it.

This patch fixes this issue by adding an extra check on remove_router_interface
to validate if there is any other subnet attached to the router before asking
the plugin if there is any port on the l3 agent.

Change-Id: Id7d0bd4e1ceca3376b7c1159316d5d69447e4df2
Closes-Bug: #1443524
Co-Authored-By: Swaminathan Vasudevan <swaminathan.vasudevan@hp.com>

commit_message:
Show create time for nets, subnets, ports, fips and sgs

Consumers and operators need to know when their resources created,
include but not limited to "nets", "subnets", "ports", "floatingips"
and "securitygroups".

And now we can easily add id or tennat_id by inheriting "HasID", but
there is no such way for add timestamp.

This patch provide a new mixin class named "HasTimestamp" and now every
resource which need show create time can just inhert it.

Why it add dict and extentsion attribute by edit each file rather than
add a new extension is we should provide this attribute in a natural
way(make it just as it should be), or it may confuse developers in the future.

Why it use string to store created_at is because resource may used in
messaging, and now datetime is not json serializable.

Change-Id: Ie56bc6cd788233d9e5b36d12cfa73f1f86b216eb
Closes-bug: #1475834

subject: Fix is_service_enabled when using multiple arguments
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}, {'_account_id': 8984, 'name': 'George Peristerakis', 'email': 'gperiste@redhat.com', 'username': 'peristeri'}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-10 11:32:02.000000000', 'files': ['functions-common'], 'message': 'Fix is_service_enabled when using multiple arguments

is_service_enabled might actually fail to return the expected result if
there is a is_${service}_enabled function available and multiple
services are checked.

For example, if one defines swift as a service but disables glance, the
following check fails:

 if is_service_enabled swift glance horizon; then
     install_swiftclient
 fi

This is because the second for-iteration resets the local "enabled" var
again to 1 and finally exits with 1 as a return code.

This patch fixes this.

Change-Id: Ic76b72897efe9597d1412470353895001a1a4c66
'}]
commit_message:
Fix is_service_enabled when using multiple arguments

is_service_enabled might actually fail to return the expected result if
there is a is_${service}_enabled function available and multiple
services are checked.

For example, if one defines swift as a service but disables glance, the
following check fails:

 if is_service_enabled swift glance horizon; then
     install_swiftclient
 fi

This is because the second for-iteration resets the local "enabled" var
again to 1 and finally exits with 1 as a return code.

This patch fixes this.

Change-Id: Ic76b72897efe9597d1412470353895001a1a4c66

commit_message:
Re-adds VIF_TYPE_VHOST_USER to portbindings extension

- This change re-adds the definition of the VIF_TYPE_VHOST_USER
  constant to the neuton portbinding extension.
- This change enables reuse of a single common VIF_TYPE_VHOST_USER
  constant between all agents and mechanism drivers that wish
  to support the qemu vhost-user interface type.

Change-Id: If92afb03f91a9092657e5b50c058f258952bafd8
Partial-Bug: #1477611

commit_message:
[cli] Remove "rally info" command

We have "rally plugin" command that does the thing from rally info
in better way.

Fix step_8_discovering_more_plugins.rst tutorial

Change-Id: Ifb1f7cfa322765b06a3db4964b17963541daf816
